# Explanatory Memorandum
## To Decree-Law No. 130 of 2025
### Approving the Agreement on the System for Linking Payment Systems among the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf
Stemming from the objectives of the Basic Statute of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, which calls for strengthening ties among the Cooperation Council states and developing cooperative relations between them in various fields, and in line with the Economic Agreement of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, which aims to bolster the economies of the Council states in light of global economic developments.
Based on the decision of the Supreme Council in its thirty-seventh session regarding the approval to establish and build a system for linking payment systems in the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, the Agreement on the System for Linking Payment Systems among the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf was signed on 16/2/2022.
Articles (1) and (2) set forth the definitions and objectives of the agreement, the most prominent of which were the establishment of a system linking payment and settlement systems among the Council states, enhancing the safety and efficiency of the common Gulf payment systems, establishing the supervisory and regulatory powers of central banks over payment systems, and working towards their development.
Article (3) addressed general provisions.
Articles (4), (5), and (6) defined the powers of the Committee of Governors, the duties and powers of the central banks, and the finality of payment, settlement, and clearing, and indicated that clearing arrangements are exempt from the provisions of bankruptcy laws in the Council states.
Article (7) outlined the provisions for immunity and tax exemptions applicable to the funds of companies established under clause (1) of Article (5), the members of the boards of those companies and their employees, and the special facilities for travel and residence to enable them to perform their duties in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in each state.
Articles (8) and (9) stipulated the confidentiality of information and the method for settling disputes arising from this agreement.
Articles (10) and (11) dealt with withdrawal from the agreement, and the termination or suspension of a party's membership in the event of a breach of any of the agreement's provisions or system.
Article (12) included provisions on interpretation, stipulating that the Committee of Governors shall have the authority to interpret the provisions of this agreement, and its decisions shall be binding.
Articles (13) and (14) referred to the amendment of the agreement and its entry into force, stating that the agreement shall be considered effective from the date of deposit of the second state's instrument of ratification with the General Secretariat of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf.

Whereas this Agreement serves the interest of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and does not conflict with its obligations in the Arab and international spheres.
And whereas this Agreement is considered one of the agreements that, according to its provisions, requires ratification by law in accordance with the text of the second paragraph of Article (70) of the Constitution, and based on Article Four of the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 10/5/2024, a draft decree-law has been prepared for its approval, along with its explanatory memorandum, drafted in the appropriate legal format.

# Agreement on the Payment Systems Linkage System between the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, August 2020 G

## Preamble
The Member States of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf;
- The United Arab Emirates,
- The Kingdom of Bahrain,
- The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia,
- The Sultanate of Oman,
- The State of Qatar,
- The State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>,

Proceeding from the objectives of the Charter of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, which calls for closer approximation and stronger ties among the Member States and for the importance of developing existing cooperation relations between them in various fields, and in affirmation of the foundations and principles established by the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf.
In line with the Economic Agreement of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, which aims to strengthen the economies of the Member States in light of global economic developments and enhance their competitive capabilities,
And based on the decision of the Supreme Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى</orig> in its thirty-seventh session (Manama - 6-7 December 2016 G) regarding the approval to establish and build a payment systems linkage system for the Member States, and authorizing the monetary agencies and central banks of the Member States to own and manage the project through the establishment of an independent company owned and financed by the monetary agencies and central banks of the Member States,
Have agreed as follows:

## Article (1)
### Definitions
For the purposes of applying the provisions of this Agreement, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings assigned to each of them, unless the context requires otherwise:
**Member States:** The states of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf.
**Central Banks:** The monetary agencies, banks, and central banks of the Member States.
**Committee of Governors:** The committee formed by the governors of the Central Banks.
**The System:** A system that links the payment systems of the Member States and other entities approved to participate in the System for the purpose of transferring and settling payments and executing cross-border payment orders, including the tools, procedures, and rules for conducting financial transfers among participants.
**The Operator:** The entity that has been or will be established or appointed in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement to manage and operate the System or one of its components.
**The Participant:** Any party permitted to exchange, clear, or settle through the System with other participants, whether directly or indirectly.
**Settlement:** The actual execution of the rights and obligations of participants by transferring funds or securities.
**Clearing:** The exchange and confirmation of payment orders and the determination of the net rights and obligations of any participant for the purpose of settlement.

## Article (2)
### Objectives
This Agreement aims to achieve the following:
1. Establish a system that links the payment and settlement systems among the Member States to execute transfer and settlement operations for payments and payment orders between them.
2. Enhance the safety and efficiency of the common Gulf payment systems to mitigate any potential risks to them, thereby maintaining financial stability in the participating Member States and serving their interests.
3. Establish the supervisory and regulatory powers of the Central Banks over the payment systems among the Member States, and work towards their development.
4. Enhance and develop clearing operations with the mechanism and procedures agreed upon by the Central Banks.
5. Establish a regional infrastructure and maintain its integrity to be the cornerstone upon which the common payment systems among the Member States are based, through the following:
    - a- Providing a cross-border real-time settlement system for the Member States.
    - b- Supporting transactions in the local currencies of the Member States and financial settlement operations between the Central Banks.
    - c. Promoting integration between financial markets, ensuring the speed of completion of cash transfers, standardizing their format, and ensuring their protection, as well as supporting bilateral and multilateral trade relations.

# Article (3)
## General Provisions
1. The System shall provide for the settlement and clearing of payments in the currencies of the Council states, and any currencies that the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig> deems appropriate to include from time to time. The System shall support operations with central bank funds after obtaining collateral as determined by the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig>.
2. Central Banks that may be affected by any act that violates the provisions of this Agreement shall have the right to find alternative solutions to ensure the settlement of transactions.
3. The participation of the Council states in the System shall be optional, according to the readiness of each state, and shall not be linked to contributing to the establishment of any Gulf payments company.

# Article (4)
## Powers of the Committee of Governors
In order to achieve the objectives of this Agreement, the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig> shall have the necessary powers to achieve the objectives of this Agreement, and in particular, it shall have the following powers:
1. Establishing the regulatory, supervisory, and governance frameworks for the System.
2. Adopting the necessary conditions, rules, and controls for the appointment and licensing of the System operator, and for the operation and management of the System, including business continuity.
3. Adopting the financial and accounting controls for the System.
4. Adopting the fees and tariffs related to the System.
5. Determining and establishing the regulatory and operational policies and rules for settlement and clearing operations.
6. Adopting the policies and rules necessary to determine the finality and enforceability of payment, settlement, and clearing operations.
7. Establishing regulatory, supervisory, and executive committees, and defining their jurisdictions, tasks, and responsibilities.
8. Adopting the rules, conditions, and controls for participation in the System.
9. Working on the development of rules and regulations related to Gulf payment systems.
10. Approving the linking of the System with similar regional and international systems.
11. Establishing the working procedures and governance for the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig>.
12. Adopting the necessary conditions, rules, and controls related to banning, suspending, and the default of participants in the System.

# Article (5)
## Tasks and Powers of the Central Banks
In order to achieve the objectives of this Agreement, the Central Banks shall have the following tasks and powers:
1. Establishing, owning, and appointing companies to manage and operate the System in accordance with the controls adopted by the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig>.
2. Participating in the System in accordance with the adopted conditions, rules, and controls.
3. Working on developing payment systems in a manner that keeps pace with the latest methods and practices, and ensuring the operation and business continuity of the System and its related services in accordance with the adopted conditions, rules, and controls.
4. Ensuring the transfer and settlement of transactions executed through the System in accordance with the adopted conditions, rules, and controls, including finding alternative methods to ensure this in the event of operator failure or non-provision of service, in accordance with the relevant rules and procedures necessary to achieve this.
5. Adopting the exchange rates between the currencies of the Council states and other currencies for transactions within the System.
6. Managing liquidity and financial collateral in a manner that serves the System's operations and ensures its business continuity, in accordance with the conditions, rules, and controls adopted by the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig>.
7. Establishing the necessary mechanisms to provide appropriate protection for the settlement of cross-border transactions, including the establishment of a fund to guarantee these settlements.
8. Executing accepted payment orders for participants in accordance with the conditions, rules, and controls adopted by the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig>.
9. Determining the conditions for local participants in the System.
10. Notifying the operator immediately in the event of any participant's default, in accordance with the conditions, controls, and rules for default adopted by the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig>.
11. Developing the necessary strategies to mitigate risks in their various forms, in accordance with international best practices.
12. Developing the various services related to the System.
13. Any other tasks or powers delegated by the Committee of Governors <orig>لجنة المحافظين</orig>.

# Article (6) Finality of Payment, Settlement, and Clearing
1. All payment, settlement, and clearing operations accepted through the System shall be considered valid, final, and irrevocable for any reason.
2. Clearing arrangements shall be considered valid, binding, and enforceable, and shall be exempt from the provisions of bankruptcy laws in the Council states.

# Decree No. 163 of 2025
## On the approval of a memorandum of understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Sultanate of Oman concerning cooperation in the field of consumer protection

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 G,

### Article One
The memorandum of understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Sultanate of Oman concerning cooperation in the field of consumer protection, signed in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> on 31/10/2024, the text of which is attached to this Decree, is hereby approved.

The Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

## Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Sultanate of Oman concerning Cooperation in the Field of Consumer Protection

The Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, and the Government of the Sultanate of Oman <orig>سلطنة عُمان</orig>, represented by the Consumer Protection Authority <orig>هيئة حماية المستهلك</orig>, hereinafter referred to as the "Parties".
Proceeding from the common bonds between the Parties, the distinguished fraternal relations that unite them, and their desire to achieve integration and enhance scientific, technical, and administrative cooperation in the field of consumer protection between the two countries.
And expressing the will of both Parties to strengthen cooperation between them by giving special attention to consumer protection policy, in accordance with the legislation in force in both countries,

Have agreed as follows:

### Article (1)
Through the signing of this Memorandum, the Parties shall seek to build bridges of technical, technological, and legal cooperation, and to achieve means of cooperation and coordination in all areas related to consumer protection, particularly general consumer protection policies, in accordance with the legislation in force in both countries, by creating a mechanism for the exchange of expertise and cooperation in the following areas:

1. Developing joint awareness programs between the Parties aimed at educating them about the social, economic, and environmental impact of their choices, thereby promoting sustainable consumption patterns.
2. Exchanging information, visits, and expertise; lists of information related to local and regional consumer goods prices; and research and studies related to the (electronic price movement monitoring system). In addition to jointly organizing electronic training programs, linking relevant entities that serve commercial oversight and consumer protection for both Parties, and benefiting from training and awareness courses, conferences, meetings, seminars, and related workshops held in the countries of both Parties, especially those related to commercial oversight and consumer protection laws, commercial fraud crimes, and practices harmful to trade.
3. Conducting specialized studies and joint field research between the Parties regarding the impact of various goods and services on consumers.
4. Creating effective and supportive communication channels between the Parties for the establishment and development of electronic systems and programs, and cooperating in information exchange through electronic linkage between the Parties.
5. Establishing a mechanism through electronic linkage to monitor notifications of product recalls in countries around the world, and to withdraw harmful products if found in the country of either Party, and for each Party to inform the other of the information, test results, and measures taken, where permitted by the national law in the countries of each Party.
6. Activating strategic cooperation between the Parties, coordinating their positions in regional and international organizations in this field, and benefiting from them in a way that serves their common interests.
7. Each Party notifying or informing the other of activities and operations of common interest that are in practice for each Party.
8. Preparing an annual work program to implement and activate the areas of cooperation mentioned in this Memorandum, and working to organize meetings between the Parties annually or whenever necessary, on a rotating basis.
9. Working to benefit from the laboratories available to both Parties.
10. Developing plans and a program to create a sound consumer environment for children and youth.
11. ### Article (2)
Each party shall bear its own costs with respect to the visits of its delegations referred to in Article (1) of this Memorandum.

### Article (3)
The provisions of this Memorandum shall not prejudice the laws in force in either country, or the rights or obligations of either of them arising from international treaties and agreements to which either of them is a party, or bilateral agreements concluded between the two countries, nor shall they affect the obligations arising from the membership of either of them in international organizations.

### Article (4)
The two parties shall settle any disputes arising from the application or interpretation of the provisions of this Memorandum amicably through consultations via diplomatic channels.

### Article (5)
This Memorandum may be amended by mutual agreement between the two parties through the exchange of correspondence via diplomatic channels. These amendments shall be considered an integral part of this Memorandum and shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures set forth in Article (6) of this Memorandum.

### Article (6)
This Memorandum of Understanding shall enter into force from the date of receipt of the last written notification by the two parties through diplomatic channels, stating the completion of the internal legal procedures in force in both countries.

### Article (7)
This Memorandum of Understanding shall remain in effect for a period of (5) five years from the date of its entry into force, and shall be automatically renewed for another similar period, unless one of the parties notifies the other party in writing, through diplomatic channels, of its desire to terminate this Memorandum (6) months prior to the date of termination.

### Article (8)
The termination of this Memorandum shall not affect the obligations that may have arisen as a result of its implementation, unless the two parties agree otherwise.
This Memorandum was signed in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig>, on 31 October 2024 AD, in two original copies, with each party receiving one copy in the Arabic language, both having the same legal authority.

2- In accordance with Chinese laws, ownership of the land belongs to the People's Republic of China.

## Article 2
1- The Kuwaiti side must pay the relevant fees according to the payment period agreed upon between the Consulate General of the State of Kuwait in the city of Guangzhou and the People's Government of Guangdong Province, at a special preferential price of 600 US dollars per square meter.
2- The Kuwaiti side shall obtain the right of use after paying the aforementioned fees.

## Article 3
1- The Kuwaiti side may construct the following buildings on the land mentioned in item 1 of Article 1:
a- Offices of the Consulate General
b- Residence of the Consul General
c- Residence of the members of the Consulate General
d- Ancillary facilities
2- The ownership of the buildings constructed with the investment of the Kuwaiti side on the land shall belong to the Kuwaiti side.

## Article 4
The Kuwaiti side is obligated to use the land and the buildings constructed thereon for the sole purpose of building the Consulate General's premises, and it is not entitled in any way to sell, donate, mortgage, or lease them, either in whole or in part, to a third party, without obtaining the prior approval of the Chinese side.

## Article 5
The construction of the Consulate General of the State of Kuwait's buildings in the city of Guangzhou shall be subject to the relevant Chinese laws and regulations.

## Article 6
Based on the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations and the principle of reciprocity, the Chinese side shall exempt the fees and taxes, which include land tax, building tax, and construction fees during the construction of the buildings. This treatment shall be in accordance with the relevant Chinese laws and regulations, with the exception of fees for specific special services provided to the Kuwaiti side.

## Article 7
1- The Chinese side has the right, during the period of validity of the agreement, to reclaim the land for reasons related to economic, cultural, and defense construction, for the public interest, and for city replanning. In this case, the Chinese side is obligated to notify the Kuwaiti side at least one year before the date of reclamation, and to provide a substitute for the reclaimed land of the same area and quality in accordance with the conditions stipulated in this agreement (hereinafter referred to as the new land) for the purpose of constructing the Consulate General buildings for the Kuwaiti side, after obtaining the approval of the Kuwaiti side. The Kuwaiti side shall not pay any amount for the new land, and its period of use shall be complementary to the period of the reclaimed land until the end of the validity period of this agreement.
2- The Chinese side shall provide compensation for the buildings constructed with the investment of the Kuwaiti side on the reclaimed land at the time of reclamation, after both sides agree on a suitable amount of compensation through consultation and in accordance with the actual value of these buildings and facilities.

## Article 8
Based on the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations and the principle of reciprocity, if the Chinese side wishes to open its consulate in the State of Kuwait in the future, the Kuwaiti side must provide similar facilities and assistance in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in the State of Kuwait.

## Article 9
As for the detailed matters related to the use of the land, an executive agreement shall be signed between the Consulate General of the State of Kuwait in the city of Guangzhou and the People's Government of Guangdong Province.

## Article V
The construction of the premises of the Kuwaiti Consulate-General in Guangzhou shall comply with relevant Chinese laws and regulations.

## Article VI
Pursuant to the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations and the principle of reciprocity, the dues and taxes relating to the land, the buildings and the construction procedures shall be exempted by the Chinese side. The implementation of exemption from dues and taxes shall follow the relevant Chinese laws and regulations. However, exemption shall not cover the expenses on specific services provided to the Kuwaiti side.

1. During the period covered by this Agreement, if the Chinese side needs to use the above land for economic, cultural, defense or public purposes or due to changes in city planning, it should notify the Kuwaiti side at least one year in advance and, based on the same terms set forth in this Agreement, provide the Kuwaiti side with an alternative site of the same size and quality (hereinafter referred to as the new land), which, with the consent of the Kuwaiti side, will be used for building the Kuwaiti Consulate-General premises. The Kuwaiti side shall not pay any additional expenses for the new land. The land use period of the new land shall be the remainder of that of the retrieved land.

2. For buildings and facilities on the retrieved land that belonged to the Kuwaiti side, the Chinese side shall pay reasonable compensation agree upon by the two sides in light of the actual value of the buildings and facilities in retrieving time.

## Article VIII
Pursuant to the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations and the principle of reciprocity, if the Chinese side wishes to open a consular mission in Kuwait in the future, the State of Kuwait will provide similar facilities and assistance for the People's Republic of China in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in Kuwait.

## Article IX
The Kuwaiti Consulate-General in Guangzhou and the Guangdong Provincial People's Government shall decide specific matters on the use of the land in a separate agreement on implementation.

## Article X
Any dispute arising out of the implementation or interpretation of this Agreement shall be settled through friendly consultation between the Contracting Parties.

## Article XI
1. This Agreement shall enter into force from the date of receipt of the last written notification whereby one of the sides informs the other through diplomatic channels that it has fulfilled the national legal procedures required for the entry into force of this Agreement.

2. This Agreement can be amended in the form of a supplementary agreement by consent of the Contracting Parties. The supplementary agreement will be effective following the procedures mentioned in paragraph 1 of this article and shall be an integral part of this Agreement.

3. This Agreement shall remain in force for a period of 70 years. If the Kuwaiti side hopes that the Agreement continues to remain in force, it should apply to the Chinese side, at least one year prior to the expiry date.

A supplementary agreement may be signed after consultation and agreement between the Contracting Parties in accordance with the relevant Chinese laws and regulations.

# Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan on Cooperation in the Field of Culture and Arts

The Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig> and the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan <orig>حكومة جمهورية أوزبكستان</orig>, hereinafter referred to as "the Parties":
Desiring to establish and develop cooperation in the fields of culture and arts between the two countries, and to encourage the exchange of cultural activities and agreements, while respecting the cultural diversity and freedom of expression of their peoples, in accordance with the regulations and rules in force in both countries, have agreed as follows:

## Article (1)
The Parties shall encourage mutual understanding between them, with the aim of preserving their cultural identities and supporting their development, as well as learning about the arts, culture, and cultural forms of their peoples, through the exchange of visits and activities between the peoples of the two countries.

## Article (2)
The Parties shall work to promote and facilitate direct contact between them in the fields of literature, arts, cinema, architecture, museums, libraries, archives, and other cultural fields.

## Article (3)
The Parties shall encourage participation in book fairs held in both countries under the patronage of the host country.

## Article (4)
The Parties shall encourage participation in cultural and artistic festivals, competitions, and exhibitions (music, theater, cinema, fine arts, folklore, antiquities, and museums), and participation in conferences, seminars, and forums held in both countries within the framework of this Agreement.

## Article (5)
The Parties shall encourage the holding of a children's cultural week in both countries, which shall include the following events:
- A musical or theatrical performance for children;
- Holding an exhibition of children's drawings;
- Conducting art workshops for children led by professional artists in the field of children's arts;
- Screening of children's films;
- Organizing a book fair featuring books and stories for children and youth, by authors and publishers from both countries;
- Holding seminars and study circles addressing issues concerning children and youth.
- Providing brochures about children's festivals held in both countries;

### Article (6)
The two Parties shall exchange expertise, receive students and researchers in the field of theater, and exchange visits of theatrical troupes between the two countries.

### Article (7)
The two Parties shall exchange visits of musical and folklore troupes, as well as exchange visits of experts and specialists in the field of music between the two countries.

### Article (8)
The two Parties shall work to encourage the exchange of booklets and publications, and the exchange of expertise in the fields of archaeological laboratories, restoration, and maintenance. They shall also exchange expertise in the field of archaeological research (archaeological survey and excavation), through the dispatch of archaeologists for fieldwork at important archaeological sites.

### Article (9)
The two Parties shall work on the preservation and maintenance of manuscripts, the exchange of modern scientific indexes and publications, and the exchange of visits of experts and specialists in the field of heritage and museums between the two countries to revive and preserve popular heritage.

### Article (10)
In order to establish the foundations of cooperation between the national libraries in the two countries, the two Parties shall exchange cultural and artistic expertise, and provide books, periodicals, and bulletins issued by various cultural institutions and national bibliographers, and everything that helps to introduce the history, cultural fields, and traditions in both countries.

### Article (11)
The two Parties shall encourage acquaintance with the literary production in both countries, and shall exchange cultural publications issued in both countries.

### Article (12)
The two Parties shall encourage the holding of cultural weeks between the two countries, through the exchange of invitations between the General Secretariat of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters in the State of Kuwait <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب في دولة الكويت</orig> and the Ministry of Culture in Uzbekistan <orig>وزارة الثقافة في أوزبكستان</orig>, to participate in international festivals and various cultural events held annually in both countries. The details shall be agreed upon through official channels.

### Article (13)
All financial costs arising from the holding of cultural events and activities between the two countries shall be covered by mutual agreement between the two Parties.

### Article (14)
Any dispute arising from the interpretation or implementation of this Agreement shall be settled through diplomatic channels and through consultation and negotiation between the two Parties.

### Article (15)
1. This Agreement shall enter into force from the date on which the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan <orig>حكومة جمهورية أوزبكستان</orig> receives written notification from the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig>, through diplomatic channels, stating that it has completed all necessary national procedures for its entry into force.
2. This Agreement may be amended by the consent of both Parties, and the amendment shall become effective in accordance with the procedures referred to in the preceding paragraph.
3. This Agreement shall remain in effect for a period of five years and shall be automatically renewed for a similar period or periods, unless one Party notifies the other Party in writing of its desire to terminate it six months before the end of the original period or any subsequent extension period.
4. The termination of this Agreement shall not affect the implementation of any existing agreements, programs, or activities under this Agreement until their completion or expiration.

Done in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> on February 17, 2025, in two original copies, in the Arabic, Uzbek, and English languages, all texts being equally authentic. In case of divergence in interpretation, the English text shall prevail.

  "page_summary": "This page contains Articles 3 through 15 of a cultural agreement between Kuwait and Uzbekistan, covering book fairs, festivals, children's cultural weeks, and exchanges of experts, as well as clauses on costs, disputes, and the agreement's implementation."

### Article (3)
The Parties shall encourage participation in book fairs held in both countries sponsored by the receiving country.

### Article (4)
The Parties shall encourage participation in festivals, competitions and cultural and artistic exhibitions (Music, Theatre, Cinema, Formative Arts, Folklore, Archeology and Museum), participation in conferences, symposia and seminars held in both countries within the framework of this Agreement.

### Article (5)
The Parties shall encourage holding cultural week for children in both countries, and it shall include the following events:
- Music or theatre show for children;
- Holding an exhibition for children painting;
- Holding artistic workshops for children presented by professional artists in children arts;
- Showing films for children;
- Holding a book fair including books and stories for children and youth, by authors and publishers of both countries;
- Holding symposia and seminars discussing children and youth issues;
- Presenting booklets for children festivals held in both countries;
- Organizing an exhibition for traditional traditional games and customs.

### Article (6)
The Parties shall exchange experiences, receiving students and scholars in the field of theatre, as well as exchanging visits of theatrical groups between both countries.

### Article (7)
The Parties shall exchange visits of music and folkloric groups, as well as exchanging visits of experts and specialists in the field of music between both countries.

### Article (8)
The Parties shall encourage the exchange of booklets and publications, as well as exchanging experiences in the fields of archeological laboratories, restoration and conservation. They shall also exchange experiences in the field of archeological research (Archeological survey and excavation), through delegating archeologists for field work in significant archeological sites.

### Article (9)
The Parties shall preserve and conserve manuscripts, exchange catalogues and new scientific publications, as well as exchange visits Of experts and specialists in the field of heritage and museums between both countries for the revival and maintenance of folklore.

### Article (10)
In order to establish bases of cooperation between national libraries in both countries, the Parties shall exchange cultural and artistic experiences and provide books, periodicals and brochures published by different cultural institutions and national bibliographers, and everything that helps introduce history, cultural fields and traditions of both countries.

### Article (11)
The Parties shall encourage getting acquainted literary production in both countries, also exchanging cultural publications issued in both countries.

### Article (12)
The Parties shall encourage holding cultural weeks between both countries, through exchanging invitation between the Secretariat General of the National Council for Culture, Arts and Letters in the State of Kuwait and the Ministry of Culture in Uzbekistan, to participate in international festivals and different cultural occasions held annually in both countries. Details shall be agreed upon through official ways.

### Article (13)
All financial costs consequent of holding cultural events and activities between both countries shall be covered upon mutual consent between both Parties.

### Article (14)
Any dispute occur out of the interpretation or implementation of this Agreement between the Parties shall be settled through diplomatic channels and through consultations and negotiations.

### Article (15)
1. This Agreement shall enter into force from the date on which the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan receives a written notification from the Government of the State of Kuwait, through diplomatic channels, stating that it has fulfilled all the national procedures necessary for its entry into force.
2. This Agreement can be amended with the consent of both Parties. Amendment will be effective according to the procedures mentioned in the previous paragraph.
B. This Agreement shall remain in force for a period of five years and automatically renewed for similar period or periods, unless either Party notifies the other in writing about his intention to terminate this Agreement within six months before the termination of the initial period or any extended period.
4. Termination of this Agreement will not affect the implementation and validity period of any existing agreements, programs or activities under this Agreement until their full completion or expiration.

Done in Kuwait City, on the date of 17th of February 2025, in two original copies in the Arabic, Uzbek and English languages, each text being equally authentic. In case of any divergence of interpretation, the English text shall prevail.

**For**
**the Government of the**
**State of Kuwait**

**For**
**the Government of the**
**Republic of Uzbekistan**

He shall also be obligated to submit a periodic report to the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> every three months, which includes a detailed statement of the management's activities. This report shall be presented to the Special Investigation Committee for the Trial of Ministers for review and to take what it deems appropriate, until a final judgment is rendered in the case under investigation or a decision is issued to lift the seizure of the aforementioned funds.

Fifth: This decision shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall remain in effect until a final and conclusive judgment is rendered in the case. The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>, and the President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> shall be notified to implement its provisions, each within their respective jurisdiction, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Acting Chairman of the Special Investigation Committee
for the Trial of Ministers

Whereas the applicant submitted a memorandum dated 29/6/2025, which included the restructuring proposal, with the proposal documents attached, and proof of notification to all creditors of the restructuring proposal and its attachments.
And whereas the bankruptcy trustee <orig>أمين التفليسة</orig> submitted his letter dated 30/6/2025, confirming his approval of the restructuring plan and the feasibility of implementing its provisions.
And whereas the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued the decision dated 30/6/2025 setting the date for the first meeting to approve the restructuring proposal for Sunday, 13/7/2025, at ten o'clock in the morning (10:00) at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>.
And whereas the trustee submitted his letter dated 6/7/2025, announcing the report on the restructuring activities and the list of accepted debts, and a statement of the accepted and excluded debts.
And whereas the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued the decision dated 6/7/2025 to publish the provisional list of debts in two local daily newspapers, one of them in English, and to publish it in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
And whereas on the day set for the first meeting to approve the restructuring proposal, the proposal did not obtain the legally required majority for its approval.
And whereas the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued the decision dated 13/7/2025 setting the date for the second meeting to approve the restructuring proposal for Sunday, 27/7/2025, at ten o'clock in the morning (10:00) at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>.
And whereas on the day set for the second meeting to approve the restructuring proposal, the legally required majority for the approval of the proposal was achieved, with the approval of each of the following: 1- Tas-hilat Al-Sayer General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة تسهيلات الساير للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>. 2- Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> – formerly Ahli United Bank <orig>البنك الأهلي المتحد</orig>. 3- A'ayan Auto Leasing Company <orig>شركة أعيان لتأجير السيارات</orig>. 4- Commercial Beverage Company (Coca-Cola) <orig>شركة المرطبات التجارية (كوكاكولا)</orig>. 5- Berlin General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة برلين للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>. 6- Saber Mohamed El-Shahat Metwally <orig>صابر محمد الشحات متولي</orig> (in his personal capacity). 7- Al-Abduljaleel Tourism and Travel Company <orig>شركة العبدالجليل للسياحة والسفر</orig>. With the remaining creditors rejecting the plan: 1- The Commercial Real Estate Company <orig>الشركة التجارية العقارية</orig>. 2- Afrah Al-Sabah Tourism and Travel Company <orig>شركة أفراح الصباح للسياحة والسفر</orig>. 3- Eastern Constructions General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الانشاءات الشرقية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.

## Legal Basis:
Whereas Articles (1, 76, 79, 122, 123, 124, 126, 127) of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 stipulate that: "In the application of the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning indicated next to each of them..: Required Majority: The majority required to consider a matter presented at a creditors' meeting as approved, which is achieved if the following conditions are met: 1- The attendance of the affected creditor or affected creditors present, representing at least more than half of the affected debts, at the meeting where the vote will take place. 2- The approval of the creditor or creditors present, representing two-thirds of the debts represented at the meeting. 3- The approval of the numerical majority of the affected creditors after excluding related parties from voting at the meeting...". "The debtor must invite the creditors to approve the preventive settlement proposal by means of a notice that includes the time and place of the meeting, in accordance with the procedures set forth in the preventive settlement proposal, provided that the meeting is held at least ten days after the date of sending the invitation to the meeting and within a period not exceeding one month from the date of notifying the representative of the creditors' committee and the committee members of the plan and its attachments. The debtor shall also send the invitation within the period specified in the preceding paragraph to the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, if the debt is subject to its supervision, and to the relevant regulatory authority if the debtor is subject to its supervision. The debtor shall preside over the meeting, and with the approval of the required majority, a person from among the creditors or others may be chosen to preside over the meeting...". "The preventive settlement proposal shall be deemed to have met the creditors' approval if the required majority approves it. If the proposal does not obtain the approval of this majority in the first creditors' meeting, the meeting shall be postponed for a period of ten days for a second meeting to be held to vote on the proposal...". "With the exception of the provisions contained in this section, the provisions contained in the chapter on preventive settlement shall apply to the approval of the restructuring plan, to the grievance against this approval, to the ratification of the plan and the effect of this ratification, as well as to the implementation of the plan and the termination of its procedures before its implementation". "The debtor must invite the creditors to approve the restructuring plan by means of a notice that includes the time and place of the meeting, in accordance with the procedures set forth in the restructuring plan, provided that the meeting is held no later than one month from the date of notifying the representative of the creditors' committee and the committee members of the plan and its attachments. The debtor shall also send the invitation within the period specified in the preceding paragraph, by notifying the debtor and all creditors of the notice referred to in the preceding paragraph and its attachments...". "The trustee shall supervise the implementation of the restructuring plan for the duration of the plan and until its implementation is completed...". "The trustee shall be committed to the following: 1- Monitoring the progress of the plan and notifying the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>—as the case may be—of any failure to implement it. 2- Ensuring that the sale of any of the debtor's assets decided to be sold in accordance with the restructuring plan is carried out at the best price obtainable under the prevailing market conditions on the date of sale, and that the sale proceeds are used as set forth in the plan. 3- Submitting a report on the progress of the plan's implementation to the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>—as the case may be—every three months, and every creditor has the right to obtain a copy of this report."

## Therefore, we have decided the following:
First: The restructuring plan proposed by the applicant is hereby ratified.
Second: The restructuring trustee shall supervise the implementation of the restructuring plan in accordance with the mechanism and period agreed upon in the plan, provided that he submits a report to the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> on the progress of the plan's implementation every three months. The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall notify the applicant, the creditors, the trustee, and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> of this decision in accordance with Article (55) of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020, publish it in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and register it in the Commercial Register of the debtor company.

Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig># Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

# Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>
## Ministerial Decree No. (228 / 2025)
### Concerning the amendment of the name of the Master's program in International Law, Diplomatic and International Relations offered at Sorbonne University Abu Dhabi in the United Arab Emirates on the list of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance

- Having reviewed Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 concerning the Civil Service and its amending laws.
- And upon the Decree issued on 4 April 1979 regarding the Civil Service System and its amendments.
- And upon Amiri Decree No. (417) of 2010 issued on 25 October 2010 concerning the establishment of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Decree No. (272) issued on 3 October 2012 concerning allowing Kuwaiti students to enroll for study outside the State of Kuwait only in universities for which a ministerial decree is issued by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance.
- And upon Academic Decision No. (2014/32) dated 8 July 2014 concerning the list of higher education institutions in which enrollment is permitted for undergraduate and postgraduate programs in the United Arab Emirates.
- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance No. (7) issued on 31 December 2014, which includes the mechanism for issuing decisions related to identifying higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait whose graduates' qualifications are permitted for accreditation.
- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance No. (2014/5) concerning the determination of criteria for selecting higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait.
- And based on the letter from the Cultural Office in Dubai <orig>المكتب الثقافي في دبي</orig> No. (M.Th.D/1192/2025) dated 6 August 2025.
- And based on the recommendation of the Committee for Proposing Standards and Reviewing and Updating Lists of Higher Education Institutions Outside the State of Kuwait in its tenth meeting held on 10 August 2025.
- And upon the presentation of the Director General of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance.
- And in accordance with the public interest.

(It is decided)
**Article One**

The name of the Master's program in International Law, Diplomatic and International Relations shall be amended to Master's in International Law, Spaces, and Sovereignty at Sorbonne University Abu Dhabi in Academic Decision No. (2014/32) dated 8 July 2014, concerning the permission to study in the United Arab Emirates.

**Article Two**

This decision shall take effect from its date and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبد الله محمد الجلال</orig>

Second: The plate is covered with white reflective paper and has two red adhesive strips at the bottom, separated by the symbol (CD), which contains a watermark of the State of Kuwait emblem with a diameter of (18) mm, at a rate of no less than (3) marks every (305) mm.

1- A dark blue outer frame surrounding the entire plate.
2- The plate is divided into two sections.
The first section, measuring (265) mm x (155) mm, contains:

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1754 Seventy-First Year

- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976 concerning the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its amendments.
- And upon the letters of the Assistant Undersecretary for Traffic and Operations Affairs Nos. 38, 40, 68, 203399 dated 2/4/2025, 13/4/2025, 15/5/2025, and 18/6/2025, and their attachments.
- And based on the proposal of the Acting Undersecretary of the Ministry.

**It is decided**

**(Article 1)**

A new article, numbered (212 bis), shall be added to the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976, with the following text:

**Article (212 bis)**

**First:**
The following words and phrases shall have the meaning indicated next to each:
- The Law: Law No. 67 of 1976 regarding Traffic.
- Alternative Penalties <orig>العقوبات البديلة</orig>: These are the penalties stipulated in this law which the judge may impose instead of the original penalty of imprisonment for the committed crime, with one or more of the alternative penalties prescribed in this law and its executive regulations.
- The Concerned Department: The General Department of Traffic <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig>.
- Community Service Work <orig>العمل في خدمة المجتمع</orig>: It is the assignment of the convicted person to one of the tasks designated for public benefit without compensation, taking into account that the work is compatible with the circumstances of the convicted person.
- Attendance of Awareness, Rehabilitation, and Training Programs and Lectures: It is obligating the convicted person to undergo one or more rehabilitation and training programs and awareness lectures (in a governmental or private institution or a public benefit association in the medical, psychological, social, educational, vocational, industrial, or religious fields) to correct their behavior, by defining the rehabilitation and training programs, awareness lectures, and their implementation procedures.
- Rectification of Damage Arising from the Crime <orig>إصلاح الضرر الناشئ عن الجريمة</orig>: It is obligating the convicted person to restore the item to its original state, repair it, or compensate for it.

**Second:** The penalty of community service work shall be implemented in the following entities, according to the nature of the crime and the circumstances of the convicted person, and in coordination with the General Department of Traffic <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig>:

<table_caption>Community Service Tasks and Corresponding Government Entities</table_caption>
<table>
| Nature of Work That Can Be Performed | Entity |
|:---|:---|
| Participation in traffic awareness campaigns and participation in the work of the General Department of Traffic - Participation in correctional and rehabilitation institutions and participation in civil defense work | Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> |
| Participation in organizing appointments - Assisting in health awareness campaigns | Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> |
| Assisting in organizing school libraries - Participation in student awareness campaigns - Cleaning or organizing tasks | Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> |
| Participation in social care activities - Distribution of aid - Assisting in social development centers - Cooperative societies | Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإجتماعية</orig> |
| Arranging Qur'ans and cleaning mosques - Assisting in preparing religious activities | Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الأوقاف والشئون الإسلامية</orig> |
| Participation in documenting electricity meter data | Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> |
| Participation in maintenance and fieldwork - Participation in painting sidewalks | Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> |
| Assisting in consumer awareness - Distributing awareness brochures - Support at awareness exhibitions | Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> |
| Participation in cleaning coastlines - Planting trees - Removing waste - Participation in environmental campaigns | Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig> |
| Participation in organizing cemeteries and managing funeral affairs - Assisting in waste removal and cleaning | Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> |
| Training convicts in simple trades - Organizing craft workshops | Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> |
| Participation in raising awareness among expatriate workers - Assisting in organizing training courses - Translation | Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> |
| Participation in cleaning public parks and planting trees | Public Authority for Agriculture and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة للزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> |
| Participation in removing waste from roads - Painting sidewalks and organizing signs | Public Authority for Roads and Land Transport <orig>الهيئة العامة للطرق والنقل البري</orig> |
| Participation in charitable works and humanitarian aid - Training in simple trades - Participation in awareness campaigns - Administrative support | Public Benefit Associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> |
| Work inside fuel stations | Ministry of Oil <orig>وزارة النفط</orig> |
</table>

**Third:**
The awareness, rehabilitation, and training programs and lectures, which aim to educate about the dangers of traffic violations, the importance of adhering to traffic rules, rehabilitating violators, and increasing their awareness of traffic and safety rules, shall include the following programs:
- Educational lectures.
- Training workshops.
- Psychological and behavioral programs aimed at modifying irresponsible driving behaviors.

Fourth:
The General Department of Traffic <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig> shall be responsible for organizing the awareness, rehabilitation, and training programs and lectures stipulated in these regulations, in cooperation with governmental or private entities and public benefit associations.

Fifth:
The reparation of damage shall be implemented in coordination with the party affected by the crime, and the implementation shall include one of the following measures:-
- Restitution to the original state: By returning the item to its condition before it was damaged, through its replacement.
- Reparation of damage: By repairing it and restoring it to its previous condition.
- Financial compensation: A sum of money or material satisfaction of the same kind as the damage incurred by the affected item due to the harmful act, for which restitution to its original state or reparation was not possible, in an amount equivalent to restoring the item to its previous condition.
The value of the damage reparation shall be determined in coordination between the General Department of Traffic <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig> and the government entity that owns the damaged movables or properties.

Sixth:
The General Department for the Enforcement of Judgments <orig>الإدارة العامة لتنفيذ الأحكام</orig> shall notify the General Department of Traffic <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig> of the issuance of the alternative penalty.

Seventh:
The entity where the alternative penalty is being served shall be obligated to submit a report to the General Department of Traffic <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig> indicating the extent of the convicted person's compliance with the penalty's execution.
In the event of non-compliance by the convicted person, the General Department of Traffic <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig> shall notify the Traffic Judgments Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة تنفيذ أحكام المرور</orig> to refer the matter to the competent court to proceed with the execution of the original imprisonment sentence against them.

### (Article 2)
The Acting Undersecretary of the Ministry shall implement this decision, and it shall come into effect one month after the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (71) of 2025
### Regarding the termination of the assignment of the Deputy Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security for Financial and Administrative Affairs

The Acting Minister of Finance and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment,
Having reviewed:
- The Social Security Law issued by Amiri Order by Law No. (61) of 1976, promulgating the Social Security Law and its amending laws,
- And Ministerial Decision No. (83) of 2022 assigning the Deputy Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security for Financial and Administrative Affairs,
- And Amiri Decree No. (150) of 2025 appointing an Acting Minister,
- And upon the presentation of the Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security,
- And in accordance with the powers vested in us,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest,
Has decided:-

### (Article One)
The assignment of Mr. Abdullah Mohammed Ali Al-Mutairi <orig>عبد الله محمد علي المطيري</orig> as Deputy Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security for Financial and Administrative Affairs is terminated, and he shall return to his previous position.

### (Article Two)
The competent authorities shall implement this decision. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Dr. Subeeh Abdulaziz Abdulmohsen Al-Mekhaizeem <orig>د. صبيح عبدالعزيز عبدالمحسن المخيزيم</orig>
Minister of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy
and Minister of Finance
and Acting Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment

Issued on: 27 Safar 1447 H
Corresponding to: August 21, 2025 AD# Ministerial Decision No. (73) of 2025
## Regarding the termination of the assignment of the Deputy Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security for Insurance Affairs

The Acting Minister of Finance and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment,
Having reviewed:
- The Social Security Law issued by Amiri Order by Law No. (61) of 1976, promulgating the Social Security Law and its amending laws,
- And Ministerial Decision No. (78) of 2022 assigning the Deputy Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security for Insurance Affairs,
- And Amiri Decree No. (150) of 2025 appointing an Acting Minister,
- And upon the presentation of the Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security,
- And in accordance with the powers vested in us,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest,

Has decided:-
### (Article One)
The assignment of Mr. Salama Ibrahim Salama bin Salama <orig>سلامة إبراهيم سلامة بن سلامة</orig> as Deputy Director General of The Public Institution for Social Security for Insurance Affairs is terminated.

# Ministerial Decision No. (72) of 2025
## Regarding the Termination of the Assignment of the Deputy Director General of the Public Institution for Social Security for Information Technology Affairs

The Minister of Finance and Acting Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment,,
Having reviewed:
- The Social Security Law promulgated by Amiri Order by Law No. (61) of 1976, issuing the Social Security Law and its amending laws,
- And Ministerial Decision No. (84) of 2022 assigning the Deputy Director General of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> for Information Technology Affairs,
- And Amiri Decree No. (150) of 2025 appointing an acting minister,
- And upon the proposal of the Director General of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>,
- And in accordance with the powers vested in us,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest,

Has decided:-
### (Article One)
The assignment of Mrs. Manal Saad Al-Adsani <orig>منال سعد العدساني</orig> as Deputy Director General of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> for Information Technology Affairs is terminated, and she shall return to her previous position.

### (Article Two)
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Decision No. PAI (237) of 2025 Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General <orig>المدير العام بالتكليف</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Ministerial Decision No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Section <orig>قسم التفتيش الصناعي</orig>, No. (A4-242), dated 05/08/2025, which states that M/s. Kuwait Gypsum Ceilings Factory – Naseema Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Roumi <orig>مصنع الكويت لاسقف الجبس – نسيمة محمد عبدالعزيز الرومي</orig> committed the following violation:
  - Encroachment on state property by an area of approximately 160 m2 by stacking and storing iron bases outside the plot boundaries.
- And based on the submission of the Deputy Director General for Specifications and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
- And in the public interest.

## It is decided

### (Article One)
To close Plot No. (101) <orig>القسيمة رقم (101)</orig>, located in the Western Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>منطقة الشعبية الصناعية الغربية</orig> – Block (6) <orig>قطعة (6)</orig>, belonging to M/s. Kuwait Gypsum Ceilings Factory – Naseema Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Roumi <orig>مصنع الكويت لاسقف الجبس – نسيمة محمد عبدالعزيز الرومي</orig>, until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.

### (Article Two)
In the event the violation is not removed within (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

### (Article Three)
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالتكليف</orig>

- Ministerial Resolution No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.

(Article One)
To close Plot No. (1158) <orig>القسيمة رقم (١١٥٨)</orig>, located in the Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area – Block (1), until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.

(Article Two)
In the event the violation is not removed within (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

(Article Three)
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

- Ministerial Resolution No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to sign the penalties of warning and closure against violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (A3-191), issued on 3/2/2025, which includes the commission of the following violation by M/s Golden Sands Insurance Brokerage Company <orig>شركة الرمال الذهبية لوساطة التأمين</orig>:
  - Engaging in an industrial/craft activity without a license.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (499/2025/5) held on 23/02/2025.
- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
- And in the public interest.

**It is decided**

### (Article One)
To close Plot No. (1527) <orig>القسيمة رقم (1527)</orig> located in the Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area – Block (1) – belonging to M/s Golden Sands Insurance Brokerage Company <orig>شركة الرمال الذهبية لوساطة التأمين</orig> – until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.

### (Article Two)
In the event the violation is not removed after the passing of one (1) month from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

### (Article Three)
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

**Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالتكليف</orig>**

Issued on 17 August 2025 AD

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (160) of 2025
### Concerning a private marketing license for a collective investment scheme established outside the State of Kuwait, granted to Ahli Capital Investment Company to market the shares of IVC HS Digital I Ad–On Syndication Limited

**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Bylaws, and their amendments;
- The Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association of Ahli Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة أهلي كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>, and the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, INVESTCORP ASSET ADVISORY SERVICES LIMITED, and the marketing manager, Ahli Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة أهلي كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- The application of Ahli Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة أهلي كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to conduct the private marketing of the shares of IVC HS Digital I Ad–On Syndication Limited;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**The following has been decided:**

### Article One:
Ahli Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة أهلي كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 910 shares (only nine hundred and ten shares) of IVC HS Digital I Ad–On Syndication Limited Company, established in the Cayman Islands, within the State of Kuwait. The offer price shall be 100,000 US Dollars (only one hundred thousand US Dollars) per share, in addition to a subscription fee of 3.0% of the investor's investment commitment.

### Article Two:
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Bylaws of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and Regulation of Securities Activities and its amendments. The entity receiving subscription applications shall be:
- Ahli Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة أهلي كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>.

### Article Three:
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

### Article Four:
The duration of the marketing license is one year, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

### Article Five:
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this resolution. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, this resolution shall be considered null and void.

### Article Six:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Zeyad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليح</orig>**
**Head of the Supervision Sector <orig>رئيس قطاع الإشراف</orig>**

Issued on: 26 August 2025 AD

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces Public Tender (A.D./T/767) for the supply of fuel cards for the Amiri Diwan. Those interested in participating from companies or institutions specialized in this field may obtain the booklet of conditions and tender documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7 - Tenders and Follow-up Department). This is available during official working hours starting from the date of this announcement's publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for a non-refundable fee of (150 K.D.) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (Payment via K-Net only) for the booklet. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees (upon presentation of a certificate proving such status). This is available from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:

1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 11/9/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids shall be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department - at Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7.
3- A preliminary deposit of (3,000 K.D.) must be submitted in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid for the duration of the bid's validity, which is (90) days.
4- A valid certificate of fulfillment of the national labor percentage must be submitted.
5- An authorization letter and a copy of the Civil ID of the company's representative are required to purchase the tender documents.
6- This public tender is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The tenderer must submit a letter with an attached copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
8- The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving the right to extend or renew this period for the duration(s) it deems appropriate to complete the awarding procedures.
9- The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Monday, 8/9/2025, at 10:00 AM in the Administrative Building at Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig>.

2- Direct line: 22011419

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the offering of Auction No. W.A/72/2025-2026 (A) for the utilization and operation of the space designated for investment (Shop No. 2) in the Cultural Heritage Village (Youm Al-Bahar) at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> (Rgaag and Saj Restaurant), in accordance with the technical terms and specifications contained in the auction documents. These documents can be purchased via the Ministry of Information's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> website using the barcode attached to the announcement, starting from Sunday, 31/8/2025, for a non-refundable fee of only twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Bids shall be submitted to the Procurement Department – Ground Floor – Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> – Al-Soor Street, in sealed envelopes, accompanied by a preliminary deposit of not less than 2% and not exceeding 5% of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, irrevocable, and reservation-free letter of guarantee issued by a local bank in the State of Kuwait in favor of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, valid for the duration of the bid (90 days). The envelope must be sealed with red wax and marked on the outside with the auction number as indicated above, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 21/9/2025.

The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Wednesday, 10/9/2025, at 11:00 AM at the office of the Director of the General Services Department in the Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>الشويخ الصناعية</orig>, Plot 1, Street 14, General Services Department of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, to answer inquiries regarding the auction. Anyone who has purchased the auction documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. All that is recorded in the minutes of the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the auction documents and shall be binding on the bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their responses to all bidders after approval and before the bid closing date.

- The aforementioned fee is to be paid via K-Net <orig>كي نت</orig> card.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must adhere to submitting them to the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> at the time and place specified for the preliminary meeting.
- The bid must be submitted in a single sealed envelope containing all documents, filled out, signed, and stamped by the bidder.
- All documents must be submitted on three (3) non-copyable CDs, with the exception of the bid form and the preliminary deposit, which are to be submitted as hard copies.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing the documents.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to participate in the auction must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- The auction is indivisible, and alternative bids will not be accepted.
- This announcement is an integral part of the auction documents.
- To obtain a copy, the bidder must register and pay the fees through the website https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase

Tender documents can be obtained starting from Sunday, 31/8/2025, and on the following days during official working hours (at the Tenders Section) in the Ministry building located in the Al-Riq'i <orig>الرقعي</orig> area (6th Floor).
- The deadline for submitting bids is Sunday, 21/9/2025, at 1:00 PM. Bids received after this deadline will not be considered. Please note that the aforementioned fees are non-refundable.
- Bids shall be submitted to the Tenders Section accompanied by a preliminary guarantee in favor of the Ministry of Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig> for an amount of 1,000 K.D., in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a local bank in the State of Kuwait. The submitted guarantee must be valid for a period of 90 days from the date of unsealing the envelopes.
- Any bid not accompanied by the original preliminary guarantee, or if the value or duration of the guarantee is less than required, will be disqualified.
- All companies participating in the tender are invited to attend the unsealing of the envelopes at the time and place specified in the table above.

**Notes:**
1. Bidders for this tender must meet the following conditions:
   - Be registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> as well as the Ministry of Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig>.
   - Submit a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the company's files regarding government contracts registered with the Authority.
2. All bid documents must be submitted on non-writable CDs or electronic flash drives (3 copies), in addition to submitting paper copies of the bid form, price schedules, and the original preliminary guarantee.
3. Tenders, practices, and any other works announced by the Ministry of Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig> can be followed up through the following link: https://tenders.awqaf.gov.kw
