# Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces Auction No. W.A/75/2025-2026 for the utilization and operation of the investment space, Shop No. 1, in the Cultural Heritage Village (Sea Day) <orig>قرية الموروث الثقافي (يوم البحار)</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> (for the sale of traditional Kuwaiti sweets). This is in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the auction documents, which can be purchased via the Ministry of Information's website using the QR code attached to this announcement, starting from Sunday, 31/8/2025, for a non-refundable fee of 20 K.D. (twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only). Bids must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> – Ground Floor – Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> – Al-Soor Street <orig>شارع السور</orig>, in sealed envelopes. Bids must be accompanied by a preliminary guarantee of not less than 2% and not more than 5% of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, irrevocable letter of guarantee free of any reservations, issued by a local bank in the State of Kuwait in favor of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, valid for the duration of the bid (90 days). The envelope must be sealed with red wax and marked on the outside with the auction number as indicated above, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 21/9/2025.
- The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Wednesday, 10/9/2025, at 1:00 PM in the office of the Director of the General Services Department <orig>مدير إدارة الخدمات العامة</orig> in Shuwaikh Industrial Area, Plot 1, Street 14, General Services Department of the Ministry of Information, to answer inquiries regarding the auction. Anyone who has purchased the auction documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. All minutes of the meeting will be considered an integral part of the auction documents and shall be binding on all bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their responses to all bidders after approval and before the bid closing date.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid via K-Net card.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, or other requests must adhere to submitting them to the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> at the time and place specified for the preliminary meeting.
- The bid must be submitted in a single sealed envelope containing all documents, filled out, signed, and stamped by the bidder.
- All documents are to be submitted on 3 non-writable CDs, with the exception of the bid form and the preliminary guarantee, which must be submitted as paper copies.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the prescribed fees for purchasing the documents.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to participate in the auction must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- The auction is not divisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the auction documents.
- To obtain a copy, the bidder must register and pay the fees through the website: https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase

# International Marine Construction Company (K.S.C) <orig>شركة الإنشاءات البحرية العالمية (ش. م. ك)</orig>
## Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting No. (06)

Held on Tuesday, 12/08/2025, at 11:00 AM at the company's office.

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of the International Marine Construction Company <orig>شركة الإنشاءات البحرية العالمية</orig> held its meeting at the company's office located in the Murqab area – Chamber of Commerce and Industry Building – Kuwait, upon the invitation of Mr. / Ahmed Saad Al-Munifi <orig>أحمد سعد المنيفي</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The meeting was attended by:

Representatives of the company's shareholders as follows:
<table_caption>List of Shareholders and their Respective Stakes</table_caption>
<table>
| Name | Number of Shares | Percentage |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Contracting and Marine Services Company – Agency (Mr. / Ali Dughaim Al-Shammari <orig>علي دغيم الشمري</orig>) | 9,905,000 | 99.050% |
| Abdulaziz Rashed Al-Rashed <orig>عبدالعزيز راشد الراشد</orig> – Agency | 10,000 | 0.100% |
| Ahmed Saad Al-Munifi <orig>أحمد سعد المنيفي</orig> – In Person | 10,000 | 0.100% |
| Total | 9,925,000 | 99.25% |
</table>

The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, who presided over the session, began by welcoming all attendees and confirmed that 99.25% of the company's shareholders were present at the meeting.

The Assembly reviewed the following agenda:

1. Approval of increasing the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from K.D. 1,000,000 (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to K.D. 5,000,000 (five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), an increase of K.D. 4,000,000 (four million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), with a share value of 100 (one hundred) fils. This is to be done by distributing free bonus shares at a rate of 400% of the company's capital, to be distributed to the shareholders registered in the company's records as of the date of the General Assembly meeting.

**Resolution:**
The General Assembly unanimously approved the increase of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from K.D. 1,000,000 (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to K.D. 5,000,000 (five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), an increase of K.D. 4,000,000 (four million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), with a share value of 100 (one hundred) fils. This is to be done by distributing free bonus shares at a rate of 400% of the company's capital, to be distributed to the shareholders registered in the company's records as of the date of the General Assembly meeting. The Board of Directors is authorized to take all necessary measures to implement this resolution in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

2. Approval of the amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> and Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>:

### Text Before Amendment:
The company's capital is set at K.D. 1,000,000 (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), equivalent to 10,000,000 shares (ten million shares), and all shares are cash shares.

### Text After Amendment:
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at K.D. 5,000,000 (five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), equivalent to 50,000,000 shares (fifty million shares), and all shares are cash shares.

**Resolution:**
The General Assembly unanimously approved the amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> and Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>:

### Text Before Amendment:
The company's capital is set at K.D. 1,000,000 (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), equivalent to 10,000,000 shares (ten million shares), and all shares are cash shares.

### Text After Amendment:
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at K.D. 5,000,000 (five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), equivalent to 50,000,000 shares (fifty million shares), and all shares are cash shares.

The Board of Directors was authorized to take all necessary measures to document the amendment with the official authorities.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Al-Ahlia Chemicals Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الأهلية للكيماويات ش. م. ك (مقفلة)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Al-Ahlia Chemicals Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الأهلية للكيماويات ش. م. ك. (مقفلة)</orig> was held on Wednesday, July 30, 2025, at 11:00 AM at the headquarters of the parent company, Al Raya Tower 2 – Sharq, with the attendance of shareholders representing 99.4% of the capital. The meeting was chaired by Mr. / Dherar Khalid Al-Rabah <orig>ضرار خالد الرباح</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, and in the presence of:
- The Auditor, Mrs. / Naran Shoukry <orig>نارعان شكرى</orig> from / BDO Qais Al-Nisf & Partners office <orig>مكتب BDO قيس النصف وشركاه</orig>

At the beginning of the meeting, the Chairman of the session welcomed the attendees. After announcing that the legal quorum for convening the Extraordinary General Assembly was met, the Chairman proceeded to discuss and vote on the items listed on its agenda. The discussions resulted in the following resolutions:

### Agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly
– Approval was granted to amend the text of Article (47) of the company's Articles of Association to read as follows:

### Text of the Article Before Amendment
1. A percentage of not less than 10% (ten percent) of the net profits shall be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
2. The Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
3. The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding 5% (five percent) of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not permit the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a voluntary reserve that would allow for the distribution of this percentage of profits.
4. Any amount deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years permit, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
5. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor and social security laws.
6. The company's contract may provide for the establishment of a special fund to assist the company's workers and employees.

8. The Ordinary General Assembly may, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. The validity of this distribution is conditional upon it being from realized profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.

### Text of the Article After Amendment
1. A percentage of not less than 10% (ten percent) of the net profits shall be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a statutory reserve for the company.
2. The Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
3. The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding 5% (five percent) of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not permit the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a voluntary reserve that would allow for the distribution of this percentage of profits.
4. What has been deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years permit, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
5. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor and social security laws.
6. The company's contract may stipulate the establishment of a special fund to assist the company's workers and employees.
7. A percentage not exceeding 10% (ten percent) of the net profits may be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a voluntary reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.
8. Subject to the provisions contained in the company's contract, the Ordinary General Assembly may, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or the end of each financial period. The validity of this distribution is conditional upon it being from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.
9. A percentage of 1% (one percent) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
- The signature of a minority shareholder is considered, given that attendance by proxy was at a rate of 99.4%.

The meeting concluded at 11:15 AM, and at its conclusion, the Chairman of the session thanked the shareholders for their attendance and active participation.

### Attendance:

- Mr. Hani Mohammed Shawqi Younis <orig>هاني محمد شوقي يونس</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors – Chairman of the meeting.
- After the conclusion of the Ordinary General Assembly's business, the Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors (Chairman of the meeting) opened the session at 10:00 AM and announced the completion of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, with the attendance of shareholders representing (88.803%) of the capital stock (by proxy). The agenda items were then discussed, and the Extraordinary General Assembly approved the following resolutions by unanimous consent of those present:
1. Approval to cancel and write off the entire balance of treasury shares, numbering 8,900,224 shares, with a total value of 4,628,117 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>, as shown in the consolidated financial statements for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024, and to reduce the company's capital by the nominal value of the treasury shares, amounting to 890,022.400 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. The surplus difference in the nominal value of the treasury shares, amounting to 3,738,095 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, is to be covered from the retained earnings and reserves balance. Accordingly, the company's capital will be reduced from 11,300,788.950 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> to 10,410,766.500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> (only ten million, four hundred ten thousand, seven hundred sixty-six Kuwaiti Dinars and 500 fils).
2. Approval to amend Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (5) of Chapter One of the company's Articles of Association, to be as follows:

### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The company's capital was set at 11,300,788.950 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (only eleven million, three hundred thousand, seven hundred eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars and 950 fils), divided into 113,007,889 shares (only one hundred thirteen million, seven thousand, eight hundred eighty-nine shares), with a nominal value of one hundred Kuwaiti fils per share, all of which are cash shares.

### Text of the Article After Amendment:
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at 10,410,766.500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> (only ten million, four hundred ten thousand, seven hundred sixty-six Kuwaiti Dinars and 500 fils), divided into 104,107,665 shares (only one hundred four million, one hundred seven thousand, six hundred sixty-five shares), with a value of 100 Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.

Chairman of the Meeting

2- Mr. Nasser Saud Al-Manea <orig>ناصر سعود المنيع</orig>, representative of the Gulf Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.

After the Chairman of the Assembly announced that the legal quorum for convening the Extraordinary General Assembly was met, he opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees. The items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly were then discussed one by one, and the Assembly unanimously adopted the following resolutions:
First: Approval to amend the text of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:
Text before amendment:—
The purposes for which the company was established are as follows:
1- Operating maritime shipping lines between the State of Kuwait, the Gulf Cooperation Council countries, and the rest of the world for the transport of passengers, general commercial goods, containers, refrigerated goods, solid and liquid materials, foodstuffs, and all types of goods, whether for the company's account or for others.
2- Buying and selling ships, watercraft, passenger vessels, feeder vessels, container ships, commercial and refrigerated vessels, and generally new, used, or owned floating means of maritime transport.
3- Providing services to ships, supplying ships with their needs and requirements, repairing them, temporary chartering of ships, managing ships, operating ships, and the buying and selling of old ships for the purpose of depreciation for scrap and similar purposes.
4- Obtaining agency rights for local or foreign companies related to transport, shipping, and unloading, whether for shipping lines, and acting as a commission agent for maritime services for temporarily chartered ships. The purposes shall not be practiced except after obtaining the necessary licenses from the concerned authorities in accordance with the laws and regulations in this regard.
5- Managing and operating the company's own ships as well as ships belonging to others, and services related to and associated with this activity.
6- Establishing any industry related to or connected with maritime transport, after the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>.
7- Maritime transport of all kinds, ship services, and ship catering, after the approval of the Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig>.
8- Providing studies and consultations related to the company's activity.
9- Practicing e-commerce activities related to the company's activity.
10- Representing specialized companies in the maritime transport industry for passengers and goods and their commercial agencies, all after the approval of the Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig>.
11- Managing BOT (Build-Operate-Transfer) system projects in the State of Kuwait and abroad of all types related to the company's activity.
12- Owning the movable and real properties necessary to carry out the company's activity within the limits permitted by law.
13- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
Text after amendment:—
The purposes for which the company was established are as follows:

<table_caption>Approved Business Activities</table_caption>
<table>

|---|---|---|
| 1 | Project Management | 821110 |

</table>
These resolutions are subject to the approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> and other official authorities, and the completion of all publication procedures.
(The Extraordinary General Assembly concluded its meeting at 11:10 AM).

Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig>

## Announcement

**Issuance of Public Tender No.: M.F.A: 2025/3-2026**

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> announces its need to issue a tender for the renewal of the Oracle automation system for the Ministry's General Diwan, in accordance with the general and special conditions and technical specifications detailed in the tender documents. Specialized companies wishing to participate in the tender are requested to visit the Procurement and Institute Monitoring Department at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs building – Arabian Gulf Street, to obtain the tender documents during official working hours from (10:00 AM to 1:00 PM) for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, payable in cash. The tender documents must be purchased during the period from Monday, 01/09/2025, until Thursday, 14/09/2025, with the inclusion of the following documents:

1- An authorization letter from the company to purchase the tender in the name of the individual, along with a copy of their civil ID.
2- Payment of the prescribed fees for purchasing the tender documents via Knet.
3- A copy of the commercial register.
4- A copy of a "recent" certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
5- A copy of a "recent" registration receipt from the Central Agency for Public Tenders.
6- The company must be specialized in this field.
7- Annual labor percentage certificate.

In addition to any conditions the competent authority may deem appropriate, please note that the preliminary meeting for the tender will be held on Wednesday, 10/09/2025, at 11:00 AM at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs building – Arabian Gulf Street. The deadline for submitting and closing bids is Sunday, 14/09/2025, from 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after this time will be accepted. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening. The value of the initial guarantee is (1500) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, and it must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity (note that the tender is not divisible).

This is for your information...

For inquiries, please contact Mr. Mohammed Abathra'a <orig>محمد اباذراع</orig> at Ext: 7731 – or Mrs. Sabika Al-Sadani <orig>سبيكة السداني</orig> at Ext: 1128. Tel: 22225555.

Social and Labor for the year 2025, valid for one year, with the purchase of the tender and submission of the bid.

- The fee for purchasing the tender documents mentioned above is non-refundable.
- A preliminary meeting for all bidders will be held on Sunday, 14/09/2025, at the (General Services Department) at (11:00) AM. Any bidder with inquiries regarding the tender must attend in person or send a representative. ## Notice
Regarding the extension of the closing date for Tender No. (L.A. 12/2024-2025) for the repair, maintenance, and operation of two (2) swimming pools at the building of Retired Major General / Abdullatif Al-Thuwaini <orig>عبداللطيف الثويني</orig>, Saad Al-Abdullah Academy for Security Sciences <orig>أكاديمية سعد العبدالله للعلوم الأمنية</orig>, for the General Directorate of Construction and Maintenance - Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.

The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Practice No. (L.A. 14/2025-2026) for automatic transfers with various specifications for the Land Border Ports Department (Al-Salmi <orig>السالمي</orig> - Al-Abdali <orig>العبدلي</orig> - Al-Nuwaisib <orig>النويصيب</orig>) of the General Directorate of Communications Engineering at the Ministry of Interior.

## Announcement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Tender No. (L SH 55/2025-2026) for the maintenance of a self-propelled articulated electric lift and the supply of necessary spare parts for the Saad Al-Abdullah Academy for Security Sciences <orig>أكاديمية سعد العبدالله للعلوم الأمنية</orig> – for the General Department of Supply and Logistics <orig>الإدارة العامة للإمداد والتموين</orig> – at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Companies/institutions specialized in this field should visit the General Department of Financial Affairs – Tenders Department (in Industrial Ardiya) to obtain the documents for this tender for a non-refundable fee of KWD 20 (twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) (via K-Net). A preliminary guarantee of KWD 680 (six hundred and eighty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) must be submitted and placed in the financial bid for the tender. Please note that the final guarantee for the tender is 10% of the total contract value. Applicants must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), and the following documents:
- A valid registration receipt from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Or
- A registration request to register with the Ministry and then purchase the tender documents.
Please note that the closing date (for bid submission) is Monday, 15/09/2025, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Bid Opening Committee of the Purchasing Committee in the Sharq Area – Al-Siddiq School – First Floor.
A preliminary meeting will be held on Tuesday, 02/09/2025, at the headquarters of the General Department of Supply and Logistics <orig>الإدارة العامة للإمداد والتموين</orig> at 10:00 AM. Please note that any recommendations or decisions resulting from this meeting are considered an integral part of the tender documents and are binding on all companies, whether the tenderer attends the mandatory preliminary meeting or not.

# ANNOUNCEMENT

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. H/MS/43/2025/2026 – Supply and Installation of a Smart Electronic Locker System, open to companies specialized in this field, in accordance with the general and special conditions detailed in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw) for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

It is mandatory to attach a letter from the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig> when submitting the booklet, confirming compliance with the National Labor Support Law, pursuant to Law No. 19 of 2000 and the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Decision No. 1104/Fifth of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.

The closing date for the practice will be Monday, 22/09/2025, at the Tenders Box at the aforementioned address. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date. The initial guarantee <orig>الكفالة الأولية</orig> is (2%), only two percent, of the bid value, and must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.

Note: Priority will be given to small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني و تنمية المشروعات الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig>.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة</orig>

# Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee Held on 03/08/2025

After reviewing the applications submitted for the amendment of data in the births and deaths registries, it was decided to proceed with the amendment as announced below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee receives no objections within fifteen days from the date of this announcement's publication, the amendment will be made in the registries, and birth or death certificates will be issued in accordance with the following amendment:

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee Held on 03/08/2025

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, as stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, has convened.

- Mr. / Director of the Central Registry of Births and Deaths Department <orig>مدير إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig>, Chairman
- Ms. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>رئيسة قسم البحوث والرأي</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>رئيس قسم الوفيات</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>رئيس قسم القيد</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>رئيس قسم السجلات</orig>, Member
- Ms. / Aliaa Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig> served as the Committee's secretary.

The Committee reviewed applications from No. (((271))) to No. (((286))) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the births and deaths registries for requests of late birth and death registrations and applications submitted by the concerned parties to amend data in their records.

Therefore, after its review and verification that all documents and papers are complete, the Committee decides to announce the requested amendments in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement elapses without any objections being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and the birth and death certificates will be issued.

## First: Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
Deed No. 21244/2007, located in the Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area – Plot No. 50 <orig>قسيمة رقم 50</orig> – Block No. 10 <orig>قطعة رقم 10</orig> – Plan No. M/33808 – with an area of 1000 m², for the sum of KWD 649,539 (six hundred forty-nine thousand, five hundred and thirty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** And according to the attached description certificate:

- The property is a private residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + second floor and roof, with a violation consisting of the construction of a side annex made of concrete and light materials, and the enclosure of the ground floor balcony on the rear and front sides of the plot.
** And according to the expert's report:
- The property subject of the lawsuit conforms to the general and specific specifications of Deed No. 21244/2007, with an area of 1000 m².
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a building – a private residence in an old structural condition, overlooking two streets – a front and back on the Fahaheel Expressway <orig>طريق الفحيحيل السريع</orig> and Street No. 1. It is bordered by a neighbor on one side and a transformer and a neighbor on the other side. The exterior cladding is stone. The property has one entrance overlooking Street 1 and three entrances overlooking the Fahaheel Expressway <orig>طريق الفحيحيل السريع</orig>.
- The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, roof, and a yard with an annex. The expert knocked on the door, but no one answered. The fourth defendant and the plaintiff's agent stated that they would not be able to allow the expert to inspect the interior of the property subject of the lawsuit.
- The fourth defendant described the components of the property subject of the lawsuit from the outside and stated the following:–
- The basement is divided into two parts.
- The ground to the second floor: Each floor consists of two identical apartments in their components, where each apartment consists of a living room + 3 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms + a kitchen.
- The roof has no components.
- The annex: Consists of a guard's room in addition to a part consisting of a room + kitchen + bathroom.
- The air conditioning is central, and there is no elevator in the property.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at his liability in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the auction is immediately reopened at his liability based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and under their responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
1- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."

An undivided share of 50% of residential unit No. 2, model 1, on the second floor, with a total unit area of 349.161 m2, representing the property of Document No. 2019/4026, located in the North West Sulaibikhat <orig>شمال غرب الصليبيخات</orig> area – Plot No. (3), Plan M (39120), Parcel 8, to be sold at public auction for a base price of 89,100 K.D. (Eighty-nine thousand one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) for the offered share.
** And according to the expert's report
The property in question, as it exists on site, is located in the North West Sulaibikhat <orig>شمال غرب الصليبيخات</orig> area – Plot (3), Street (301), Building (8), with automated number 94165729. This was done in the presence and under the guidance of the second defendant and his attorney, and the plaintiff's attorney. The remaining defendants or their legal representatives failed to attend despite being properly notified. The inspection was attended by the appraisal expert, Mr. Tariq Al-Moajil <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, at the time of inspection, as follows:
The property where the unit in question is located is a residential building consisting of five (5) identical floors. The building is on a corner, overlooking a side square, a main street, and a side street.
The building has two (2) electric elevators.
The exterior cladding of the building is Sigma paint in beige and pink.
The disputed unit subject of the lawsuit is the apartment located on the second floor of the building and occupies the entire second floor.
The disputed apartment conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. 2019/4026, with an area of 349.161 square meters, and the disputed apartment has the automated number 20475396.
The apartment consists of four (4) rooms, one (1) master room, five (5) bathrooms, a kitchen, a living room, a diwaniya, a balcony, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
- The floors of the disputed apartment are ceramic, the air conditioning is central, and its construction and finishing are new.
- The second defendant stated that he is the possessor of the disputed apartment and uses it with his children, and that the disputed apartment does not generate income.
We, along with the appraisal expert, inspected the disputed apartment on site. The appraisal expert collected the data related to the apartment in preparation for estimating the value of the buildings and structures on its land, along with an estimate of the land's value, to determine the total value of the property, both land and buildings.

## First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property under Document No. 1997/3911 located in the Al-Rumaythiyah <orig>الرميثية</orig> area – Plot No. (229) – Block No. (4) of Plan No. M/27417 – with an area of 400 m2.
- Notes: There is a violation, which is the presence of rooms made of light materials on the first floor and the roof.
- Inspection:
During the expert session dated 29/6/2022, a visit was made to inspect the property subject of the dispute, located in the Al-Rumaythiyah <orig>الرميثية</orig> area – Block 4 – Street 43 – Plot 229 – House No. 28 – Automated No.: 11750202. This was conducted in the presence and with the guidance of the plaintiff in person, while the defendants or their legal representatives failed to attend despite their knowledge of the proceedings. The expert appraiser Al-Sami Al-Tarawneh <orig>السامي الطراورة</orig> was also present. The inspection was carried out as follows:
The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residence located on a single internal street with an area of 400 square meters, bordered by neighbors on both sides. Its exterior cladding is limestone, and the air conditioning is by individual units.
The expert was unable to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit from the inside, as the expert knocked on the door several times and no one answered. The plaintiff stated that he does not live in the disputed property, but rather his two brothers, Hussein <orig>حسين</orig> and Taher <orig>طاهر</orig>, reside there. The expert appraiser inspected the property subject of the dispute from the outside only and recorded his observations in preparation for estimating its base price.
The plaintiff stated that the property consists of a ground floor and a first floor. The ground floor consists of two rooms, a living room, a bathroom, and a kitchen. The first floor consists of four rooms, two bathrooms, and a balcony that has been converted into a kitchen. He also stated that the property has a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom on the ground floor.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction will start at the base price of /319,950 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, three hundred nineteen thousand, nine hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department of the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must, at the time the sale session is held, deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be repeated at their liability in the same session based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award will be judged in their favor, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be repeated in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately repeated at their liability based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction begins at the starting price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

## First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property under Document No. 2023/1197, located in the Sabah Al-Salem Suburb <orig>ضاحية صباح السالم</orig> area – Plot No. (202) – Block No. (13) – Southern part of Plan No. 36871/M – Area: 300.125 m².
- Notes: Consists of ground floor + first floor + second floor + roof.
- There are building violations for adhesion on the ground, first, and second floors – a report has been filed.
- *Inspection:*
On 2023/9/24, we proceeded to the disputed property located in the Sabah Al-Salem <orig>صباح السالم</orig> area, Block (13) – Street (2) – Avenue (6) – Plot No. (202B) – House (40), with automated number (11993191), in the presence and with the guidance of the third defendant in person. Accompanied by the expert appraiser from the administration, Mr. Saad Mubarak Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد مبارك المطيري</orig>, the inspection was conducted as follows:
The disputed property matches, in terms of general and specific specifications, the proof of ownership by inheritance document No. 1197, dated 8/2/2023, with an area of 300.125 m².
The disputed property is a house located on a single internal street, No. (2), Avenue (6), bordered by neighbors on three sides and with a frontage of 12.25 m.
The property subject of the lawsuit is divided into (3) sections, and it contains (3) entrances, with each section having its own private entrance, as detailed below:

### 1- The First Section:
- The ground floor consists of a diwaniya + bathroom and washbasins – a storeroom + a separate external rear kitchen with a bathroom + a living hall + a bathroom and washbasins + a storeroom + a bedroom.
The first floor consists of a living hall + a master bedroom + a bedroom + a bathroom + a balcony.
The second floor consists of a master bedroom – a storeroom + an unfinished room.
The third defendant was unable to allow the expert to inspect the remaining parts of the property (the second and third sections), and the components were described verbally by the third defendant.

### 2- The Second Section:
The ground floor consists of a living hall.
The second floor consists of a living hall + a master bedroom + a bedroom + a bathroom + a kitchen + a maid's room.
- The third floor is a roof with an unfinished room on it.

### 3. The Third Section:
It is an apartment located on the first floor with a separate external entrance, consisting of a living hall + a kitchen + a bathroom + a maid's room + a master bedroom + a living room.

The air conditioning for the disputed property consists of separate units.
The exterior cladding is beige mosaic stone.
The expert appraiser inspected the property, taking into consideration the newness of the construction and finishes, in preparation for estimating the highest value of the property as a base price for its sale by public auction, and to submit the relevant report. He also reviewed the case file and its documents.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the base price of /210,600 KWD (two hundred ten thousand, six hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of this price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be repeated at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award shall be judged in his favor, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with an increase of one-tenth, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is repeated in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the one-tenth increase, the auction shall be immediately repeated at his expense based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the expenses of the execution procedures amounting to 200 KWD, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those conducting the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date the judgment is pronounced, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a fair market rent."

Deputy President of the Court of First Instance

## First: Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's description certificate.
The property under Document No. 2002/18079, located in the Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area – Plot No. 163 <orig>قسيمة رقم ١٦٣</orig> – Parcel No. 9 <orig>قطعة رقم ٩</orig> – from Plan No. M/33784 – with an area of 500 m², to be sold at public auction with a starting price of (340,000 K.D.) three hundred and forty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

** Stated in the description certificate:
That the property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, and rooftop services, with no violations.

** And according to the attached expert's report:
– On the session of 9/7/2023, we proceeded to the disputed property located in the Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area, Parcel (9) – Street (4) – Plot No. (163), House No. (4) – Automated No. (12784551), to inspect the property on-site in the presence of the parties to the dispute, and with the assistance of Mr. Faisal Al-Sharhan <orig>فيصل الشرهان</orig>, an expert from the Expertise Department of the General Directorate of Experts. The inspection was carried out as follows:
The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. (2002/18079), with an area of (500 m²). It is a private residential plot overlooking one street. According to the document, the property is owned by the plaintiff and the defendant.
The disputed property consists of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, a quarter-floor on the roof, and an annex, detailed as follows:
- The ground floor consists of: a hall + a diwan <orig>ديوان</orig> + 2 bathrooms + a room + a kitchen.
- The first floor consists of: a hall + a master bedroom + 3 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms + a kitchenette.
- The second floor consists of: a hall + 2 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms + a kitchen + a sunken courtyard.
- The quarter-floor on the roof consists of: a large room + a laundry room.
- The annex consists of: a hall + 2 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms + a kitchen.
- There is one entrance to the property.
- The air conditioning consists of split units throughout the property.
- The flooring is ceramic and wood parquet.
- The walls are painted.
- Elevators: None.
- Exterior finishes: The house's fence is finished with Sigma paint, the ground and first floors are clad in marble, and the second floor and the quarter-floor on the roof have no cladding.
- Stairs: There is one internal staircase.
- The disputed property is in an old condition.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the starting price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit the full accepted price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who is willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures, without any liability on the part of the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1– This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
2– The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
3– The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

Deputy President of the Court of First Instance

Notice:

** The property description certificate states that the property is a private residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + roof. The property does not conform to the licensed plans, as there is an additional structure on the roof which violates the building rules and regulations of the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.
** According to the expert's report:
The disputed property is located in the Al-Yarmouk <orig>اليرموك</orig> area – Block 1 – Street 1 – Avenue 3 – Plot 474 – Automated Address No. 15153149, in the presence and under the guidance of the defendant's agent, the plaintiff's agent, and the technical expert, Mr. Mohammed Al-Gharibah <orig>محمد الغريبة</orig>.
The expert matched the ownership documents of the disputed property with the actual site and found a discrepancy between the plot number mentioned in Document No. 2017/4482 and the address indicated by the plaintiff's agent. The plaintiff's agent stated that the reason for this is that Plot 474 resulted from the subdivision of Plot No. 339, according to the notes on the map issued by the Survey Department <orig>إدارة المساحة</orig> of the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, submitted within the plaintiff's portfolio of documents at the session of 9/9/2024.
The expert found that the disputed property overlooks the intersection of Riyadh Street <orig>شارع الرياض</orig> and the Fourth Ring Road <orig>الدائري الرابع</orig> from the east and northeast, and overlooks Avenue No. 3 from the southwest. It is bordered by neighbors on the south and northwest sides, and is clad in stone.
The defendant's agent allowed the expert to enter and inspect the property, where it was found to be a detached house for private residence that does not generate any revenue, with the following details:
1. Lower Level at the level of Avenue No. 3: Consists of two parts. The first includes a foyer + reception room + preparatory kitchen + laundry room + storage room + maid's room with its bathroom. The second part includes parking spaces + 6 maids' rooms with their bathrooms + a preparatory kitchen + an electricity room + a sitting room.
2. Ground Floor at the level of Riyadh Street <orig>شارع الرياض</orig>: Main foyer + 3 halls + dining room + main kitchen + preparatory kitchen + room/entrance + bathroom and washbasins.
3. First Floor: 3 bedrooms, each with a bathroom + preparatory kitchen + dining room + living room + large master bedroom suite with a dressing room, bathroom, and washbasins (the suite is under renovation) + balcony.
4. Second Floor: 3 bedrooms, each with a bathroom + laundry room + rooms for air conditioning and elevator services.
5. Roof: Air conditioning services.
6. Also on the ground floor at the level of Riyadh Street <orig>شارع الرياض</orig> is an aluminum tent that includes a large diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> hall + bathroom and washbasins + a gym room + a small diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> hall + a preparatory kitchen.
7. The house's finishes are as follows: Marble floors + wooden doors + pendant and spotlight lighting + central air conditioning + it includes one elevator serving 3 floors from the lower level to the first floor.
The technical expert inspected the property and reviewed the ownership/sale contract document No. 4482, which specified the property area as 2,535 m², in preparation for estimating the value of the buildings and the land to arrive at the total value of the property.

**According to the Description Certificate:**

- Notes: Upon inspection of the property, it was found to be a private residence consisting of a basement, ground floor, first floor, and second floor. There is a violation. There are additions: construction on all floors / addition of construction on the first floor with light materials / addition of construction on the roof / new construction in the basement / conversion of part of the basement into duplex apartments and the other part into car parking / conversion and division of the property into residential apartments with a total area of 1300 meters without a license, and report No. 41892.

**And according to the Expert's Report:**

- The disputed property is located in the Jabriya <orig>الجابرية</orig> area, Block (5), Street (10), Plot No. (145), House No. (17), Automated No. (93813683) according to the Kuwait Finder program.
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residential plot overlooking one internal street, a corner of the U-turn street from the eastern side, and an alleyway, and is bordered by a neighbor on the remaining sides, with an area of 850 square meters according to Document No. 2011/5070.
- The property subject of the lawsuit has one entrance on the main facade from the eastern side, is of medium-modern construction, and has an exterior Sigma cladding.
- The property subject of the lawsuit consists of two basements, a ground floor, a first floor, a second floor, and a roof, as detailed below:

- The first basement (sunken floor) consists of 4 apartments, as detailed below:
- Apartment No. 1 is occupied by Mrs. Afifa Jumaan Al-Qattan <orig>عفيفة جمعان القطان</orig> – previously identified – as a private family residence. She stated that she owns it and allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment consists of (4 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a living room + a kitchen + a storage room + a maid's room with its bathroom), with a total area of 120.50 m2, excluding the area of the storage room as we were unable to measure it.
- Apartment No. 3 is occupied by Mr. Sadiq Ibrahim Al-Attar <orig>صادق إبراهيم العطار</orig>, holding Civil ID No. 265092700154, as a private family residence. He stated that he owns it jointly with his wife and allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment consists of (2 living rooms + a kitchen + 4 rooms + 5 bathrooms + a laundry room), with a total area of 212.88 m2.
- Apartments No. 2 and 4: The expert knocked on the door several times, but no one answered. Those present stated that they do not know who the occupant and owner of the two apartments are.

- The ground floor consists of 4 apartments, as detailed below:
- Apartment No. 5 is occupied by Mrs. Alaa Mohammed Al-Huwaili <orig>آلاء محمد الحويلي</orig>, holding Civil ID No. 274031900421, as a private family residence. She stated that she owns it and allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment is a duplex consisting of (2) living rooms + a kitchen + 4 master bedrooms + a laundry room + a balcony), with a total area of 212.68 m2.
- Apartment No. 6: The expert knocked on the door several times, but no one answered. Those present stated that they do not know who the occupant and owner of the apartment is.
- Apartment No. 7: Mr. Nawaf Adel Buarki <orig>نواف عادل بوعركي</orig>, holding Civil ID No. 279080301188, did not allow us to inspect the apartment due to special circumstances. He stated that the apartment is owned and occupied by his mother, Mrs. Aziza Abdulaziz Al-Rashed <orig>عزيزة عبد العزيز الراشد</orig>, as a private family residence. He stated that the apartment consists of (4 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a living room + a kitchen + a maid's room with its bathroom), with a total area of 240.00 m2.
- Apartment No. 8 is occupied by Mr. Hussein Al-Hammadi <orig>حسين الحمادي</orig> – previously identified – as a private family residence. He stated that he owns it and allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment consists of 2 master bedrooms with their bathrooms + a living room + a room + a bathroom + a maid's room with its bathroom, with a total area of 108.36 m2.

- The first floor consists of 3 apartments, as detailed below:
- Apartment No. 9 is occupied by Mr. Muteb Obeid Al-Ali <orig>متعب اعبيد العلي</orig>, holding Civil ID No. 259103101683, as a private family residence. He stated that the apartment is owned by his wife, Mrs. Kafa'a Hajej Huwaid Al-Anzi <orig>كفاء هجيج حويد العنزي</orig>, and Mr. Muteb Obeid Al-Ali <orig>متعب اعبيد العلي</orig> allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment consists of a living room + a kitchen + 3 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a maid's room with its bathroom + a balcony, with a total area of 104.63 m2.
- Apartments No. 10 and 11: The expert knocked on the door several times, but no one answered. Those present stated that they do not know who the occupant and owner of the two apartments are.

- The second floor consists of 7 apartments, as detailed below:
- Apartment No. 13 is occupied by Mrs. Aziza Mishari Al-Hammad <orig>عزيزة مشاري الحماد</orig>, holding Civil ID No. 261122300277, as a private family residence. She stated that the apartment is owned by her and allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment consists of a living room + a kitchen + 2 rooms + a bathroom + a maid's room with its bathroom, with a total area of 99.82 m2.
- Apartment No. 16 is occupied by Mr. Saud Abdulaziz Jumaa <orig>سعود عبد العزيز جمعه</orig> – previously identified – as a private family residence. He stated that the apartment is owned by him and allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment is a duplex consisting of a living room + a kitchen + 3 rooms + 4 bathrooms + a maid's room with its bathroom), with a total area of 124.59 m2.
- Apartment No. 18 is occupied by Mrs. Shuaa Mohammed Al-Qattan <orig>شعاع محمد القطان</orig>, holding Civil ID No. 258052100896, as a private family residence. She stated that the apartment is owned by her sister, Mrs. Iman Al-Qattan <orig>ايمان القطان</orig>, and Mrs. Shuaa Mohammed Al-Qattan <orig>شعاع محمد القطان</orig> allowed us to inspect the apartment from the inside. The apartment is a duplex consisting of (2) living rooms + a kitchen + 4 rooms + bathrooms + a maid's room, with a total area of 126.15 m2.
- Apartments No. 12 and 14: The expert knocked on the door several times, but no one answered. Those present stated that they do not know who the occupant and owner of the two apartments are.
- Apartments No. 15 and 17: The expert knocked on the door, and individuals who did not identify themselves answered and refused to allow the expert to enter to inspect the apartments.

- The second basement consists of car parking.
- The property has an elevator and an internal staircase, and the interior finishing of the corridors is standard.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
- First: The auction shall begin at the base price associated with the property. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required, either by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
- Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, plus expenses and registration fees.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale by public auction of the property described below, to be held on Wednesday, 24/9/2025, in Hall 5, on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 589/2024 Sales/2.

## Filed by:
1. Fahad Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>فهد ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.
2. Mosaed Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>مساعد ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.
3. Ali Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>على ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.
4. Saad Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>سعد ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.
5. Awatif Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>عواطف ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.
6. Amira Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>أميرة ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.
7. Haifa Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>هيفاء ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.
8. Suad Arheef Akyad Al-Fadhli <orig>سعاد ارهيف اكياد الفضلي</orig>.

## Against:
1. Fatima Hamad Hunaidi Al-Fadhli <orig>فاطمة حمد هنيدي الفضلي</orig>.
2. Arheef Akyad Hunaidi Al-Fadhli <orig>ارهيف اكياد هنيدي الفضلي</orig>.

## First: Description of the First Property:
As stated in the Municipality's description certificate.
The entire property of Document No. 1193/1993, from which Document No. 5142/2021, Document No. 1120/2022, and Document No. 9119/2023 were issued, located in the Al-Waha <orig>الواحة</orig> area – Plot No. 1699 – Parcel No. 4 – from Plan No. M/36877 – with an area of 300 m², will be sold by public auction with a starting price of (265,000 K.D.) two hundred sixty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

**\*\* The description certificate noted the following violations:**
There is a Kirby room above the first floor + a room with a Kirby roof above the first floor + a Kirby room above the ground floor.

**\*\* According to the attached expert's report**
First: On 3/1/2023, the expert visited the Al-Waha <orig>الواحة</orig> area, Parcel 4, Avenue 2, Street 5, House 2, PACI No. 14499674, to inspect the property in question, in the presence of the technical expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> and under the guidance of the first defendant and his representative. The plaintiffs and the second defendant were absent despite being properly notified. The inspection was conducted as follows:
The property is a private residence located on two streets (a corner plot), bordered by a neighbor on the right and at the rear, with a garden in front. It consists of a ground floor + first floor + a half-floor on the second level, and has 3 external entrances.
- The floors are ceramic, the ceilings have gypsum decor, and the walls have standard paint.
- The ground floor consists of (a diwaniya and bathroom + 3 living rooms + a bathroom + a master bedroom + a kitchen + a driver's room).
- The first floor consists of (a living room + 4 bedrooms + 3 bathrooms + a maid's room + a rooftop with a Kirby room).
- The second floor consists of (a living room + a bathroom + two rooms + a rooftop + a separate room on the rooftop + an unequipped kitchenette + a Kirby storage unit on the rooftop).
- The second floor is not fully furnished. The representative of the first defendant stated that the second defendant carried out the renovations.
The representative of the first defendant stated that the first defendant and the second defendant have been the beneficiaries of the property since the date of the death of the litigants' legator.
The technical expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> recorded his observations in preparation for appraising the value of the property in question.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the starting price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit the full accepted price, plus expenses and registration fees, during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of the parties initiating the sale procedures. The Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> assumes no liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1. This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2. The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3. The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

President of the Court of First Instance <orig>رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

## First: Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's description certificate.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the starting price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who is willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to execute a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

Under Document No. 5416/2010, located in the Sabah Al-Ahmad Residential City <orig>مدينة صباح الأحمد السكنية</orig> area – Plot No. 412 – Parcel No. A1 – from Plan No. M/37500 – with an area of 1914 m², to be sold by public auction with a starting price of KWD 486,900 (four hundred eighty-six thousand, nine hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

Plot No. 412 has the automated number 95101532, according to the statement of the plaintiff's agent. Its area is 1914 m² according to Property Document No. 5416/2010. The roof consists of 2 rooms + a bathroom, and the floor is not independent.
The air conditioning in the property is central, and there is an elevator in the property.
It was determined by the expert that the property does not generate income and is not rented.
