# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Monday, 29/5/2025 – Hall 5 – on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at nine o'clock in the morning – in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 2022/791 Sales/1.
Filed by: Omar Ahmed Murad Al-Kandari <orig>عمر أحمد مراد الكندري</orig>.
Against:
1- Muwanis Rashid Mohammed Al-Kandari <orig>موانس رشيد محمد الكندري</orig>.
2- The legal representative of the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, in his capacity.
3- The legal representative of the Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>, in his capacity.
Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
The property under Document No. 2012/12741 located in the Abu Ftaira <orig>أبو فطيرة</orig> area – Plot No. 340 <orig>قسيمة رقم 340</orig> – Block No. 6 <orig>قطعة رقم 6</orig> – Plan M/37883, with an area of 462.5 m², will be sold by public auction with a starting price of 462,720/- K.D. (Four hundred sixty-two thousand, seven hundred and twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the description certificate:
- The property is a private residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + second floor + and there are violations, which consist of an additional structure on the roof.
** According to the expert's report:
In the session of 12/6/2022, a visit was made to the disputed property located in the Abu Ftaira <orig>ابو فطيرة</orig> area – Block 6 – Streets 183 and 185 – House 1 – Plot 340 – PACI No.: 19977823, and it was inspected on-site in the presence and under the guidance of the defendant's agent and with the assistance of Mr. Tariq Al-Moajil <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, the department's expert. The inspection was carried out as follows:–
1. The door of the disputed property was opened by the defendant's agent, who stated that the defendant and her children currently reside in the property.
2. The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. 2012/12741 and has an area of 462.5 m².
3. The disputed property is a house located on a corner with two streets and is bordered by neighbors on both sides.
4. The disputed property consists of a basement, a ground floor, a first floor, a second floor, and a quarter-floor on the roof, with the following details:
a- The basement consists of 2 storage rooms + a large hall + a room with a bathroom + a bathroom with washbasins + a swimming pool with a shower room + ceramic flooring + a sunken courtyard + a hall at the basement entrance serving as a guest dining room.
b- The ground floor consists of: 2 halls with their corridors and a dining room with marble flooring + 3 bathrooms + 2 washbasins + a laundry room with a small room and its bathroom inside + a room serving as an office with its bathroom + a fully equipped kitchen + the ground floor entrance is a small lobby with ceramic flooring and a skylight.
c- The first floor consists of: five master bedrooms with their bathrooms + a lobby between the rooms with wood parquet flooring + a preparatory kitchen.
d- The second floor consists of: 2 halls + 4 rooms with their bathrooms and a corridor + a washroom with its bathroom + a kitchen + a maid's room with its bathroom + a balcony.
e- The roof consists of: two rooms + a bathroom + a laundry room + a service room.
5- The exterior of the property is clad in beige Sigma paint, beige stone, and grey marble.
6. The house has central air conditioning.
7. The house has an elevator from the basement to the roof.
8. There is wood decor in various places on the ground floor and in the basement.
- Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction begins at the starting price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full accepted price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at his own risk during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction is immediately reopened at his own risk on the basis of the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the costs of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and under their responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award ruling <orig>حكم رسو المزاد</orig> is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is a resident of the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."

# Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>
## Announcement
### Auction No. (MEW / 7 - 2025 / 2026)
### Installation of an Automated Teller Machine (ATM) in the Lobby of the Ministry's Main Building
The Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces an auction for the installation of an Automated Teller Machine (ATM) in the lobby of the Ministry's main building. Those wishing to participate can obtain the auction documents from the Contracts and Tenders Department – at the Ministry's main headquarters {South Surra – Sixth Ring Road – First Floor}.
This will be available starting from Sunday, 31/08/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (50 K.D.) (only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
For inquiries about any information related to the auction, please contact Engineer / Hassan Al-Qallaf <orig>حسن القلاف</orig>, Tel: 66840044. A preliminary meeting will be held on Tuesday, 16/09/2025, at 10:00 AM in the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Administrative Affairs – Ground Floor of the Ministry. Bids must be submitted along with a certificate from the {Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>} stating the company's registration for the year (2025), and the company must be registered as a supplier with the Ministry's Purchasing Department.
Bids shall be deposited in the designated box at the "Contracts and Tenders Department" at the Ministry's main headquarters {South Surra – Sixth Ring Road – First Floor} no later than 12:00 PM on Wednesday, 01/10/2025. Any bid received after the specified deadline will not be considered.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy

The Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء و الطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces the issuance of the practices listed below. The practice documents can be obtained electronically from the website https://eprocurement.mew.gov.kw.

- **Closing Date**: 10/9/2025
- **Document Fee**: As mentioned on the website and in the attached table.

- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig>, must be attached to the bid.

# Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
## Announcement
### General Tender (A.D./T/814)

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the issuance of General Tender (A.D./T/814) for cleaning services for the Amiri reception halls and their annexes at Kuwait Airport. Companies or institutions specialized in this field who wish to participate may obtain the tender terms and documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan – Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department). This is available during official working hours starting from the date of this announcement's publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for a non-refundable fee of (150 K.D.), only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (payment via K-Net only) for the booklet. Small and medium-sized enterprises are exempt from this fee (upon presentation of a certificate proving their status). This is available from 8:30 AM to 1:00 PM, with the following to be noted:

1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 18/9/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – at Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- A preliminary bid bond of (3,000 K.D.) must be submitted in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity, which is (90) days.
4- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage must be submitted.
5- A letter of authorization and a copy of the Civil ID of the company representative purchasing the tender documents.
6- This general tender is indivisible, and alternative bids are not permitted.
7- The tenderer must submit a letter with an attached copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8- The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date. The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserves the right to extend or renew this period for any duration it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.
9- The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Monday, 8/9/2025, at 10:30 AM at the Amiri Airport.

# General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>

## Announcement

The General Secretariat announces its desire to issue Tender No. (1-5202/2026) for the major maintenance of four (4) restrooms in the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development. Companies wishing to apply for this tender must observe the following:
1. Be registered with the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development and listed with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> before the issuance of this announcement.
2. The applying company must have experience in this field and provide proof thereof.
3. The General Secretariat will begin distributing the tender conditions starting from the date of this announcement's publication for a period of ten working days.
4. The tender conditions can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department for a fee of KWD 75 (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
5. A preliminary meeting will be held with the bidders on Monday, 8/9/2025, at 10:00 AM in the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development.
6. Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Financial Affairs Department no later than 1:00 PM on Sunday, 14/9/2025.

## Announcement

5. A preliminary meeting will be held with the bidders on Monday, 8/9/2025, at 10:00 AM in the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development.
6. Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Financial Affairs Department no later than 1:00 PM on Sunday, 14/9/2025.

- A valid certificate of fulfillment of the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- In accordance with the text of Article 48 of the Public Tenders Law No. 49 of 2026.
- Bid envelopes will be opened at the time and place specified in the tender documents in a public session in the presence of the bidders or their representatives.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested tenderers to attend the envelope-opening session.
- Companies wishing to attend the bid opening must bring the following documents: a copy of the Civil ID, a copy of the signature authorization.
- In the event that a person other than the authorized signatory attends, a written letter from the person whose signature is authorized with the Central Agency for Public Tenders must be presented, authorizing whomever they deem appropriate to attend the session.

# Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects (KAPP) <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>
## Al-Khiran Power Generation and Water Desalination Plant – Phase I <orig>محطة الخيران لتوليد الطاقة الكهربائية وتحلية المياه – المرحلة الأولى</orig>
### Invitation to Bid Announcement

The Bidding Committee for the Al-Khiran Power Generation and Water Desalination Plant – Phase I project, in coordination and cooperation with the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects (KAPP) <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> ("the Authority") and the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy (MEWRE) <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والمياه والطاقة المتجددة</orig> of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, is pleased to invite the qualified investors ("Qualified Investors") announced in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> Issue (1665) dated 10/12/2023 and referred to below, to obtain the Request for Proposal (RFP) documents and participate in the bid for the implementation of the Al-Khiran Power Generation and Water Desalination Plant – Phase I project for the production of electrical power and desalinated water ("the Project"), in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 39 of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم 39 لسنة 2010</orig> concerning the establishment of Kuwaiti public joint-stock companies to undertake the construction and execution of electric power and water desalination plants in Kuwait, its amendments, and its executive regulations, and Law No. 116 of 2014 <orig>القانون رقم 116 لسنة 2014</orig> regarding Public-Private Partnerships and its executive regulations:

### Qualified Consortia:
<table_caption>Qualified Consortia</table_caption>
<table>
| Consortium Members | Consortium Lead | No. |
|:---|:---|:---|
| A.H Al Sagar & Brothers Co • JERA Co. • | Abu Dhabi National Energy Company (TAQA) | 1 |
| Gulf Investment Corporation • | ACWA Power Company | 2 |
| Malakoff International Limited • Abdul Aziz Al Ajlan Sons Co. • | China Power International Holding Limited | 3 |
</table>

### Qualified Companies:

</table>

## 1- Project Summary:
The ("Project") includes the financing, design, construction, operation, maintenance, and transfer of the Al-Khiran Power Generation and Water Desalination Plant – Phase I, a plant for the production of a net electrical capacity of not less than 1,800 megawatts minimum and a net desalinated water capacity of not less than 33 million imperial gallons per day. The project will operate on a mixture of liquefied natural gas and high-pressure natural gas, with gas oil as a backup fuel.
The project is located in the Al-Khiran <orig>الخيران</orig> area, adjacent to the southern border of the current Al-Zour South <orig>الزور الجنوبية</orig> plant site, approximately 100 km south of Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> on the coast of the Arabian Gulf <orig>الخليج العربي</orig>.

## 2- Project Objective:
Through this project, the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects (KAPP) <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> and the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy (MEWRE) <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والمياه والطاقة المتجددة</orig> aim to encourage private sector participation in the country's construction and development projects due to its positive impact on the local economy, particularly by attracting capital and transferring technology and knowledge. This achieves competition, enhances the efficiency of the workforce, raises the level of services provided, contributes to meeting the country's growing needs for electrical energy, provides the basic infrastructure for implementing the state's other projects within its development plan, improves the level of power generation and water production to strengthen the existing grid, and provides job opportunities for national cadres.

## 3- Contract Duration:
The winning investor must enter into the necessary contracts with the relevant parties, which will extend for (28) years and (6) months (the investment period). The project company must enter into an Energy Conversion and Water Purchase Agreement (ECWPA) <orig>عقد تحويل الطاقة وشراء المياه</orig> with the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy (MEWRE) <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والمياه والطاقة المتجددة</orig>, under which it will export its production to the electricity grid and water transmission network in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> for a period of (25) years from the full commercial operation date of the plant (the contract period).

## 4- Contractual Framework:
The agreements include the legal and commercial terms and conditions governing the project's operation, including, for example, the following terms and conditions:
- Development, financing, design, supply, engineering, construction, testing, and operation of the plant and the 400 kV substation for exporting electrical power;
- Ownership, operation, and maintenance of the plant by the project company.
- The conditions that will govern the shareholders' agreement for the common facilities, which will be signed by the project company.
- The terms for subscribing to the company's shares for the purpose of owning, operating, and maintaining the common facilities.
- The conditions that will regulate the sale and purchase of electricity and water between the project company and the buyer, and the terms and conditions for making payments to the project company.
- The rights and obligations of the parties regarding the supply of fuel to the plant and the manner of its delivery, receipt, storage, and use at the plant.
- Deductions and compensations payable by the project company in the event of a breach of the agreement's terms and conditions, and any other compensations.
- The conditions and procedures for the transfer of the project's assets and employees to the state upon the expiration of the contract period, including the requirements for handing over the assets and the project to the state.
Other agreements will include, but are not limited to (the Commitment Deed, the Substitution Agreement, the Land Lease Agreement for the project site, the Land Lease Agreement for the development of common facilities, the Lease Agreement for areas designated for temporary use, and the Shareholders' Agreement for the establishment and management of the project company).

## 5- Fee for Obtaining Tender Documents:
Qualified Investors wishing to obtain the Request for Proposal documents must sign a confidentiality agreement and submit it to the Authority before receiving those documents.
The Authority invites Qualified Investors to obtain the Request for Proposal documents from# Al-Khiran Power Generation and Water Desalination Plant - Phase I

by paying a sum of 8,000.

# Al Khairan Phase 1 Independent Water and Power Producer Project

## Announcement of Request for Proposal

The Bidding Committee of Al Khairan Phase 1 Independent Water and Power Producer Project in coordination with Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects (“KAPP”), and the Ministry of Electricity & Water & Renewable Energy (“MEWRE”) in the state of Kuwait are pleased to invite the qualified bidders (“Qualified Bidders”) whom were announced in the official Gazette issue No.(1665) dated 10/12/2023 to participate in bidding in the Request for Proposal (“RFP”) process in relation to the procurement of the Independent Water and Power Producer for Al Khairan Phase 1 (the ‘Project’) in accordance with Law No. 39 of 2010 establishing Kuwaiti joint stock companies to undertake the construction and implementation of electric power and water desalination plants in Kuwait, its amendments and its Executive Regulations, and Law (116/2014) and its Executive Regulations.

## 1-Project Brief:

The Project includes the financing, design, construction, operation, maintenance and transfer of the Al Khairan Phase 1, a power and water desalination plant with a minimum net capacity of 1,800 megawatts (MW) of power and no less than 33 million imperial gallons per day (MIGD) of desalinated water (the “Project”). The Project shall be fueled by a combination of liquified natural gas and high-pressure natural gas, with gas oil as backup fuel. The Project will be located adjacent to the southern border of the existing Az Zour South conventional thermal power and desalination plant, approximately 100 kilometers south of Kuwait City on the Arabian Gulf coast.

## 2-Project Objective:

Through the launch of this Project, the Public-Private Partnership Projects Authority and the Ministry of Electricity & Water & Renewable Energy aim to Encourage the private sector to participate in construction and development projects in the State because of their positive impact on the local economy, especially through attracting capital and transferring technology and knowledge in a way that enhances the efficiency of workers and raises the level of services provided , to Provide the state’s growing electricity needs and improving the level of

### 3- Investment Period
The Winning Bidder shall sign the PPP agreements with the related parties, which would extend up to 28 years and 6 months (Investment Period). The project company shall sign the Energy Conversion and Water Purchase Agreement (“ECWPA”) with MEWRE to export electricity and water to the power and water transmission systems for a period of 25 years from the plant Commercial Operation Date.

### 4- Contractual framework
The ECWPA and related agreements shall contain legal and commercial conditions governing the work of the Project, including the following terms and conditions:
- The development, financing, design, procurement, engineering, construction, testing and commissioning of the plant and the 400 kV transmission substation for the export of electrical power and desalinated water.
- Ownership, operation, and maintenance of the plant by the project company.
- The terms that will govern the shareholder agreement of the shared facilities that will be signed by the project company.
- Terms of subscription of the project company’s shares to own, operate and maintain shared facilities.
- Terms that will regulate the sale and purchase of electricity and water between the project company and the buyer (MEWRE) and terms and conditions of the payment to the project company.
- Parties’ rights and obligations regarding the supply of fuel to the plant and its delivery, receipt, storage, and use at the plant.
- Deductions and damages to the project company in case of breach of the terms and conditions of the ECWPA and any other damages.
- Conditions and procedures for the transfer of ownership of the Project’s assets and personnel upon expiration of the contract period to the State, including requirements for the delivery of assets and the project to the State of Kuwait.

Other significant agreements will include but are not limited to Letter Agreement, Step-in-rights Agreement, Land Lease Agreements for the use of the Project site and temporary areas and Shareholders’ Agreement for the establishment and management of the project company.

Requesting approval to complete an economic concentration transaction
The acquisition by Vertishelli 68 S.r.l. (LLC) (Italy) of 100% of the shares of Optima S.p.A. (Joint Stock Company) (Italy).
In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Decision No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which stipulates that "Any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of notification or publication."
Accordingly, the Agency invites any interested party to submit its reasoned objection to this economic concentration within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.

Objection details shall be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, Al Hamra Tower, 14th Floor, by filling out the form available on the website and paying the prescribed fee.

Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

Ministerial Resolution No. (103) of 2021
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Ministerial Resolution No. (287) of 2016 concerning the Executive Regulations of Law No. (116) of 2013 on the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait and its amendments.

The Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>,

- Having perused Law No. (116) of 2013 on the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait and its amendments;
- And Decree-Law No. (20) of 1981 establishing a circuit in the Court of First Instance to hear administrative disputes and its amendments;
- And the Decree issued on January 7, 1979, regarding the competencies of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>;
- And Decree No. (190) of 2013 appointing the Director General of the Direct Investment Promotion Authority;
- And Decree No. (12) of 2021 on the formation of the Ministry;
- And Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Resolution No. (75) of 2015 regarding the determination of categories of activities and sectors excluded from the provisions of Law No. (116) of 2013 on the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait;
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (287) of 2016 concerning the Executive Regulations of Law No. (116) of 2013 on the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait and its amendments;
- And based on the proposal of the Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> of the Direct Investment Promotion Authority;
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>;

Has decided:

Article One
The text of Article (1) of the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. (287) of 2016 shall be replaced with the following text:
"In the application of the provisions of these regulations, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning indicated next to each, unless the context requires otherwise:

<table>
| Term | Definition |
| :--- | :--- |
| The Law <orig>القانون</orig> | Law No. (116) of 2013 on the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait and its amendments. |
| The Regulations <orig>اللائحة</orig> | The Executive Regulations of Law No. (116) of 2013 on the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait. |
| The Minister <orig>الوزير</orig> | The Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>. |
| The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> | The Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority. |
| The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> | The Board of Directors of the Authority. |
| The Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> | The Director General of the Authority. |
| Direct Investment <orig>الاستثمار المباشر</orig> | The influx of foreign capital into the State of Kuwait for the purpose of establishing an economic activity through an Investment Entity <orig>الكيان الاستثماري</orig> in accordance with the provisions of the Law <orig>القانون</orig>. |
| The Investor <orig>المستثمر</orig> | Any natural or legal person, regardless of their nationality, who engages in Direct Investment <orig>الاستثمار المباشر</orig> in the State of Kuwait in accordance with the provisions of the Law <orig>القانون</orig>. |
| The Investment Entity <orig>الكيان الاستثماري</orig> | Any economic project licensed by the Authority in accordance with the provisions of the Law <orig>القانون</orig>. |
| The Investment License <orig>الترخيص الاستثماري</orig> | The approval issued by the Authority for the Investor <orig>المستثمر</orig> to establish an Investment Entity <orig>الكيان الاستثماري</orig> in the State of Kuwait. |
| The License Application <orig>طلب الترخيص</orig> | The application submitted by the Investor <orig>المستثمر</orig> to the Authority to obtain the Investment License <orig>الترخيص الاستثماري</orig>. |
| The Investment Register <orig>السجل الاستثماري</orig> | The register in which the Investment Entities <orig>الكيانات الاستثمارية</orig> licensed by the Authority are recorded. |
| The Registration Certificate <orig>شهادة التسجيل</orig> | The certificate issued by the Authority indicating the registration of the Investment Entity <orig>الكيان الاستثماري</orig> in the Investment Register <orig>السجل الاستثماري</orig>. |
| The Exemption Application <orig>طلب الإعفاء</orig> | The application submitted by the Investor <orig>المستثمر</orig> to the Authority to obtain one or more of the incentives and exemptions stipulated in the Law <orig>القانون</orig>. |
| The Exemption Decision <orig>قرار الإعفاء</orig> | The decision issued by the Authority granting one or more of the incentives and exemptions stipulated in the Law <orig>القانون</orig>. |
| Projects of a Special Nature <orig>المشروعات ذات الطبيعة الخاصة</orig> | Projects that contribute to achieving the state's development goals and are characterized by one or more of the following: large capital investments, use of modern technology, creation of job opportunities for national labor, or establishment in remote or underdeveloped areas. |
</table>

# Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>
### Bid Conditions
The bidder must submit a technical offer and a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, ensuring a copy of the bid is also provided on a flash memory, in accordance with the following conditions:
The technical envelope must contain the following:
- An initial bid bond in the form of a letter of guarantee for the amount of (1,000 K.D.) "only one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>", which must be unconditional, free of any reservations, and irrevocable, issued by one of the approved banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the name of and for the benefit of the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. This bond must be valid for a period of at least three months from the deadline for receiving bids. Any bid not accompanied by this full bond will be excluded. Initial bid bonds may not be returned until after the passing of (90) ninety days from the closing date of the practice or when the winning practitioner submits the final performance bond and signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this bond, and the practitioner's creditors may not seize its amount.
- The general and special conditions and the technical data of the submitted offer.
- Complete data on the Kuwaiti subcontracting companies or individuals to whom work may be assigned

## Announcement

Extension of the Closing Date and Receipt of the Preliminary Meeting Minutes

The General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> announces the extension of the closing date and receipt of the preliminary meeting minutes for Tender No. (2024/2025/6) for the supply, installation, replacement, operation, and maintenance of sectional doors for a number of General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> centers.

Specialized merchants in this field should visit the Accounting Department (Cashier) at the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> in the Mubarak Al-Abdullah area, Second Floor, to obtain the specifications for a fee of (75 KWD) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars, no more – non-refundable, bringing with them the following documents: -

1. A copy of the Commercial Register.
2. A copy of the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate.
3. A copy of the registration receipt from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
4. A copy of the certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage for non-governmental companies, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor, valid for one year with the bid.
5. A copy of the supplier registration receipt with the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
6. The initial bid bond value is an amount of (1750 KWD) only one thousand seven hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars, no more.
7. Bids are to be submitted to the Tenders and Contracts Preparation Department at the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> in the Mubarak Al-Abdullah area (West Mishref), First Floor.

Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is Thursday, 11/09/2025, at 1:00 PM at the Tenders and Contracts Preparation Department in the Mubarak Al-Abdullah area (West Mishref), First Floor.

# Meeting Proceedings

## Item One:
The minutes of the previous committee meeting No. (2025/92) held on 19/8/2025 were approved.

## Item Two:
The attendance of the committee members for the upcoming committee meeting No. (2025/94) was recorded, and a legal quorum was confirmed for its convening.

## Announcement of a Public Practice
### For the Preparation of a Policies and Procedures Manual, and Provision of Internal Audit and Risk Management Services for the Kuwait Aviation Services Company
The Kuwait Aviation Services Company "KASCO" (K.S.C. Closed <orig>ش.م.ك مقفلة</orig>) announces the following public practice through sealed envelopes for specialized companies and institutions, as follows:

|---|---|---|

</table>

Execution period for each project component:
* Preparation of Policies and Procedures: 6 months.
* Internal Audit: 12 months.
* Risk Management: 12 months.

This is in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the practice documents. The booklet of conditions can be purchased from the office of the Secretary of the Tenders and Practices Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والممارسات</orig> at the company's administration building located in the Al-Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> area, opposite the Kuwait Airways Corporation <orig>شركة الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> building, during official working hours.
The purchase price for the booklet is 200 K.D. (two hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), non-refundable, to be paid in cash or by a certified check to the cashier, against an official receipt which must be enclosed in the sealed envelope.
The bid must be accompanied by an initial guarantee (bid bond) of 5,000 K.D. (five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), valid for 90 days from the specified bid submission date.

### Submission Conditions:
1. The bidder must be a company or institution specialized in the work subject of the practice, with proven experience of no less than (5) years, and must provide supporting documents.
2. The bidder must be registered with the Auditors Department at the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig> and registered with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.

### Preliminary Meeting:
A preliminary meeting will be held with the participating companies to explain the scope of work and answer their inquiries on Wednesday, 10/09/2025, at 11:00 AM in the meeting room at the main headquarters of the Kuwait Aviation Services Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية لخدمات الطيران</orig> in the Al-Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> area, opposite the Kuwait Airways Corporation <orig>شركة الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> building. In the event a participant does not attend this meeting, they will be fully bound by all discussions that took place and all items and decisions contained in the minutes.

- Pursuant to the text of Article (29) of Law No. 49 of 2016 regarding Public Tenders, "A single person or a group of persons collectively may not register under more than one name for classification purposes, nor submit more than one bid in a tender, with the exception of alternative bids where the tender conditions permit their submission. However, a person who has a share in separate companies, each with its own legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and general administrative body, may register themselves and each of their independent companies for classification. A bid from a tenderer who violates this article shall be considered legally null and void."
- The tenderer must deposit the bid form along with the original initial guarantee in an envelope marked with the tender name, address, and closing date, and place it in the designated bid box located at the company's headquarters – Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig> office complex – Ahmadi <orig>الاحمدي</orig> – Gate No. (1) – Building (B1) – Ground Floor.
- All required documents, records, and certificates must be submitted through the electronic system indicated above and as specified in the tender documents.
- Tenderers wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must adhere to submitting them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified in the table above for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). (Not Applicable)
- The right to attend the preliminary meeting is limited to tenderers who have purchased the tender documents, with a maximum of two persons per company, who must bring a letter of authorization from the company and a copy of the receipt for the purchase of the tender documents. (Not Applicable)
- The deadline for receiving inquiries and clarifications from companies is 04/12/2025. No inquiries or clarifications received after this date will be considered.
- A certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> and valid for one year, must be attached with the bid submission.
- Attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the tenderer's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding work in the private sector.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74 of 2019 regarding amendments to the Public Tenders Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the tender must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- Any changes to the tender will be announced through the Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> newspaper or through the commercial e-portal indicated above.
- Companies wishing to participate in this tender that meet the specifications and criteria required in the tender documents must be registered on the unified commercial e-platform (K-Tendering Portal) on the website of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries:
https://www.ktendering.com.kw → Supplier Registration → Fill in all the required details and submit the registration request
- To obtain a username and password to access the commercial e-portal, please contact the phone number +965-23898811 or email (K-HELP@KIPIC.COM.KW).
- There are explanatory guidelines on our website on how to submit a bid through the commercial e-portal.

# Kuwait Oil Company K.S.C. <orig>شركة نفط الكويت ش. م. ك</orig>
## Announcement
### Annual Plan for Supply, Contracting, and Service Contracts
The Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig> announces that in accordance with Article (33) and Article (88) of the Public Tenders Law <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة</orig> No. 49/2016 regarding the subject of the above-mentioned announcement, the plans are published weekly on the official website of the Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>. Therefore, all those interested in viewing them should visit the website continuously to obtain the latest updates by following these steps:
1- Company website WWW.KOCKW.COM
2- Click on E-business
3- Select one of the options: RFP's for Tenders and RFQ's for Procurements
4- Click on Upcoming
